Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: wondererer
Reviews.Content: It seems they are too busy to help customers. I checked with them if they found my lost watch, nobody had time to talk to me.

Reviews.Title: “About the room and service”
Reviews.Author: Alan T
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern: I recently had travel assignment for my job I was sent in to Boston for the night, I advanced booked a hotel by two weeks at the Double Tree Club Bayside. I arrived for check in at 4. For whatever reason my room was changed, at the last moment mostly likely rooms were not clean yet. Everything seemed fine until other than no ice machines worked on any floor but then at 6:00 am your hotel decided that it time to remodel the fitness center directly next to the room, and people started banging the walls, scraping up carpeting, moving my head board , shaking the lamps and making loud construction like noises at 6:00 am. Why did this hotel even use that room when remodeling is going on. It was the least classy most obnoxious things I ever experienced . This completely ruined the purpose of me getting a room to stay in. I went down to the lobby to complain. The manager said he couldn’t help me, that he could give breakfast which I didn’t take . No one offered to move, discount or comp my room. I would have taken a free future night I told him. nor Did they ask the people to stop working, This experience which isn’t over now that I have write this letter and see what you might do for me has been awful, as of right now if I get my money back , double tree does not have my, my family or my companies business.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel on the Boston Outskirts”
Reviews.Author: bkafrick
Reviews.Content: First off, this hotel is between Southie and Dorchester, Thats not a bad thing, but its really not "in boston". Second off, despite a previous reviewer stating that it was "about a mile" to the JFK T-Stop on the Red Line, its absolutely not. It was a 5-minute walk, 1/4 mile. Very doable, and perhaps the best part of this hotel. The hotel is decent. Stayed on the 6th floor which I guess had been recently renovated. Room furnishings were nice. Bathroom was a bit dated (don't think that had been touched in the renovations). Parking is easy. $10 a day. Probably not worth having a car in Boston anyway, so skip it and use cabs and the T. Warm cookies at check-in. Ask for an extra. Wireless Internet costs money, unless your a HHonors Gold or Diamond member. Free wireless is available in the lobby. The wireless is painstakingly slow though. Don't expect to stream music, or movies or anything. I ended up using my Verizon 4G Wireless card. Starbucks on the first floor. Little Bistro with it as well offering sandwiches. Not a real restaurant, but in Boston, why would you want to eat in the hotel anyway. Take the T into Boston and eat at the TONS of amazing restaurants. In fact, Dorchester offers some quant spots for dining as well. Didnt use the free shuttle, but I suppose its available to take you just about anywhere in Boston. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great idea that didn't really work”
Reviews.Author: jmasci
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend one night at the Doubletree before an early morning flight out of Logan, also to take advantage of their off-airport parking and shuttle. First the positives - clean room, nice cookie. No 3:30AM wake up call and no explanation why not. Thank goodness for my Android phone or we would have vacationed in Dorchester. Last night's pickup from the airport after a full day of travel was a disaster. When we called to request the shuttle we were told the wait would be 25 minutes, which was a bid odd at 8:15PM given their proximity to the airport. To make a long story short, the shuttle finally arrived after 1 hour and 10 minutes, again with no good explanation. When I expressed my disappointment in person, I was rewarded with more cookies. You cannot build a hotel's reputation on warm cookies; the allure is not that great.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: CarrieAlma
Reviews.Content: Good rates and close to the T Red Line and a grocery store. Walk 4 blocks up to Dorchester for some cute restaurants! Shuttle to and from airport. Clean. Cookies on arrival and check-out! Free early check-in and late check-out was super helpful. Room renovations were very distracting and noisy early in the morning. No microwave. No wireless internet. Insanely complicated shower. No decent food in the hotel...prepare to order out. Overall: Good basic place to stay. Worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very good amenities”
Reviews.Author: Hank B
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have stayed in a better hotel or location for our Park, Stay, Fly on January 27, 2012.The Doubletree lobby was beautifully redecorated and the room on 6th floor was newly redone - very comfortable pillow top mattress.Very clean hotel and ultra friendly staff. Free van -15 minutes to airport with friendly drivers.Also a plus - free van pick up to wonderful Amrheins Restaurant was a very enjoyable perk.We've stayed in other area Park & Fly hotels and this was by far the best.Very reasonable rate includes adjacent gated secure parking. Hank & Jane Burr

Reviews.Title: “the location is really good”
Reviews.Author: Yongtai
Reviews.Content: the price is okay. not bad, and no surprise. one bad thing is their free Wi-fi was really terrible... I'm not sure if it would be better when you buy the wi-fi service... for a traveler, it is really a good choice. the location is very convenient for you to go anywhere. the T red line is just by the hotel. if you visit Boston and wanna look around. it should be a good location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with a couple of issues”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for business. I would rate the actual hotel a 3.5 but several factors went into the overall 3 rating. The interior of the hotel and rooms are in good shape, seems like it has been rennovated some time in the past few years. The furnishings, bedding and room were all in good shape. The room was large and the staff was helpful and friendly. There was plenty of outlets to plug-in all your gagets, the flat Screen TV was large, the internet was very fast and consistent (no dropping) and the hotel was very clean. The outside doesn't seem like it was rennovated but the hotel doesn't look bad from the outside. They charge $10/night for parking which is reasonable for downtown Boston but the hotel isn't in downtown, it is several miles away. The price of the actual room was good enough that the $10 is more than reasonable. A couple of negatives that made me give the overall rating a 3. First, there was one person at the Desk and there was a substantial number of folks that needed to be checked in. He did a great job getting us all checked in as quickly as possible but it still took a while. I am not sure how busy the hotel was but they could have used a second person at the front desk. There is no real restaurant onsite and or with-in walking distance. The onsite facility was a sandwhich shop, cafe type place that also had a couple of "dinner" like options such as buffalo wings, a burger, etc. The Cafe also had hot breakfast items but I skipped breakfast because the sandwhich I had at was not particularly good. Doubletrees are a bit all over the place in terms of amenities and theme but this is the first one I have ever stayed at that didn't have a real restaurant onsite. My guess is this place was another brand before the rennovations and when the rennovations were completed they changed the branding to a Doubletree. The heat was a little too loud and definitely louder than I would have expected. Also, it was hard to control the room not being too cold or too hot. The hotel is convenient to the T like the other reviewers said but it was still about a mile. The hotel is also near the UMASS campas and the JFK Library. Unoess you want to eat at the cafe you will need to drive to find a restaurant. The area is a little confusing so get direction I would give the hotel another shot if business calls for a visit right near by. The business center had I think 3 new PCs and a laser printer or two. Te gym was a decent size too with a reasoanle amount of equipment and selectiom.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: CKF
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Doubletree Club Boston Bayside. We chose it because it is an easy five-minute walk to the UMASS/JFK Library T-station on the Red LIne, providing convenient access into Boston. We were also able to get a good deal on hotels.com that basically covered the $10 parking fee. The room was basic but very nice and recently renovated. We were near the elevator but were not bothered by any noise as I feared we might be. There is free internet access available in the lobby area, but there is a charge for in-room access. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful, but since there were just two of them (and sometimes only one), a line could quickly develop. While we did not use it, I noticed a sign about shuttle service into the center of Boston and also to the airport. There is a small cafe attached with limited offerings. If you need a reasonably priced room in the Boston area for just a night or two, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Finding an affordable hotel, conveniently located is no easy task. I made an AAA reservation for 3 nights at a quoted price of $151 per night. A few days prior to the trip, I called to change my reservation to just 2 nights. The Hilton Call center informed me the cost would go up to $199 per night. The call center told me I could contact the property directly to see if I could get a lower rate for 2 nights. I informed the call center that I would be staying at another Hilton property (Embassy Suites) in Waltham the third night and a forth night as well. The call center was unable to help, but told me to contact the property directly. I contacted the property, and was transferred to an EXTREMELY helpful and pleasant man at another Hilton property. He patiently explained that the $151 AAA rate was based on a 3 night stay. However, as I was staying at another Hilton property, he was willing and ABLE to put me in for the 2 nights at the Doubletree Bayside. I found that his manner permeated the staff at the Doubletree Bayside. Every encounter with staff helpful and more than pleasant. The property itself is showing its age, but I was told it is undergoing a complete renovation after Thanksgiving. Convenience? This property is located a mere 5 minute walk from the Red line of the Subway. Although the distance is very short, the traffic and the streets are very busy. Coming back in the evening was easy, but during the day, one must be very careful crossing the streets to the subway. One day during our stay it was raining very hard. The courtesy van drove us over to the subway stop. If you are willing to take a subway for dinner, I strongly recommend this hotel if you will be staying in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place for Travelers”
Reviews.Author: livinglearningeating
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night between landing in Boston and taking off for London. The gym is small, but gets the job done. I was just let down that none of the famous cookies were around (I got pretzels instead) and that I had to buy my own breakfast. Their cafe is such a rip off, eat in Boston or head to the grocery store around the bend!

Reviews.Title: “The more expensive the hotel, the more they nickel and dime you!”
Reviews.Author: AKArmyWife
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night before flying out of Boston to return home.As Hilton Honors members, we stay at hotels that fall under the Hotel umbrella but will NEVER stay at a Doubletree again. The hotel was overpriced, in an out-of-the way location, does not provide a regular shuttle to the airport (you have to call for it when you arrive) and offers no amenities except for a refrigerator in the room. When we inquired as to getting some bottled water, we were told they didn't offer bottled water. My husband spent $9 on four bottles in the cafe near the lobby. Later, we asked a maid about water, and she brought us two bottles (free of charge) as well as a couple of bags of chips. Obviously water (and snacks) ARE available to some guests, but I guess we didn't qualify. At more than $200/night, I don't think providing a couple of bottles of water is too much to ask for. If you're looking for complimentary WiFi in your room, you won't find it here (unless you're a Hilton Honors Gold member). WiFi is $12.95/day, unless you want to sit in the lobby where there is a hotspot. We had a fitful night of sleep because the air conditioner works on some sort of sensor (no thermostat for a guest to set) and kept shutting off, even though the room was very warm. Since you can't open the windows, there is no hope of cooling down for a good night's sleep. We brought this to the front desk's attention the next morning before leaving for the airport and the man at the front desk said that quite a few people regularly complain about the lack of temperature control in the rooms. Well then... how about you DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT?! There were black hairs in the tub (not ours!) and the shower head was grungy. The chair in our room was stained, and the remote control for the TV was so nasty that the channel select button would stick. (I think we were in room 535) I constantly washed my hands and used hand sanitizer everytime I touched something in the room. YUK! We will NEVER again choose a Doubletree Hilton when we travel. In our experience, Hampton Inns are far superior with the care and attention they provide their guests, at much less the cost. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Basic reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huddersfielddermot
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with limited facilities ESP for eating. Location south of Boston not too far from metro.staff ok,not more. Would not choose to go again. Ended up getting a taxi from airport as there was no bus pick up notice which was very poor as when we landed after 11pm there was no taxis around!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean large room convenient to T station”
Reviews.Author: Oneandapenny
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights on our first trip to Boston. The staff were friendly and the room was large (certainly to what we have experienced in New York) and clean. Bed very comfortable. Limited dining at the hotel but we wanted to eat in the city anyway. The hotel is not in the city centre but is vey close to JFK U Mass station on the T and the journey to the centre was about 15 mins. Taxi from the airport was $30 - we arrived at 22:00 so there was not too much traffic. We used the free shuttle bus back to the airport to pick up a rental car. As stated in another review this doesn't go direct but dropped off Amttrak staff at their depot and at South Station. This wasn't a problem as far as we were concerned. A chance to see more of the city and a lot of trains! Would stay again if we go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “easy commute to downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: diamondblue
Reviews.Content: Took my grandchildren, 11 year old twins for visit to Boston. Commute was a little complicated we went around the 'round-about' three times before getting it right. Welcomed to the hotel by Mariane at front desk who promptly offered everyone warm chocolate chip cookies. The kids were happy and so was I. Room was clean but could use updating. We caught Doubletree Shuttle to South Station the next morning. From there onto Hop On Hop Off Tour bus. Spent the day shopping and touring; taking advantage of the Duck Splash option on the tour bus and viewing Boston Harbor. At the end of our day we made our way back to South Station and caught Doubletree Shuttle back to the hotel. One of the best deals ever. Drivers and Staff at the hotel were warm and friendly. Starbucks Cafe which offered sandwiches and drinks needs some work. Service is confused causing long lines even if you're just picking up a soda. You end up waiting while everyone gets their sandwiches or eggs. Friendliness lacking too. The first night there they seemed more interested in getting out and closing up than they did on serving customers. I would definitely go back to this hotel but I'd pack a sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: addoll
Reviews.Content: The place could use a bit of freshening up, furnishings shabby in some rooms and spotty carpet. Overall the staff was friendly and helpful but calls for extra items are left on a voice mail and not acted on. Convenient short walk to T

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Convenient to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Bonhams
Reviews.Content: Two minute walk to the "T" station, which will get you anywhere in Boston for $2. Shuttle to and from the airport, very nice drivers. Great coffee makers in the rooms. The staff went out of their way to give me helpful suggestions for lunch and dinner, Roland at the front desk was the best that anyone could ask for. Room was very clean, including the bathrooms. The lobby area is great for entertaining guests, and meeting other people. The bed was very comfortable, I will go back to Boston, and I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, free shuttle to downtown, very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Rosanne P
Reviews.Content: I'll try to itemize this as best I can.. 1) The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the rugs could use a good cleaning, and the website is a bit deceiving. Make no mistake, we had no view of a bay. However, it beats paying $300 a night, or more, downtown. Plus, it's quiet there. 2) The hotel is used mostly by business travelers, so you can get starbucks or a fruit plate, etc there. 3) You can get sandwiches, a full breakfast and midnight snacks if you need anything. 4) There is a free shuttle to the Doubletree Hilton in downtown Boston at 8AM and 12PM. You can take either of these to downtown Boston. We took the shuttle and then hopped on the Old Town Trolley tour at the downtown hotel. However, the downtown trolley doesn't take you back there, so make a note to yourself where you are. The closest trolley stop is #6. The shuttle back to the Doubletree bayside isn't until 8:30PM, so it's up to you if you can wait that long. If not, the cab ride is about $12 back. 5) Brochures to attractions are by the doors that lead to the parking lot in the back. 6) Warm cookies when you check in! 7) Staff is fantastic! 8) If you have a car, there is a Stop&Shop, Target, Marshalls, TJMaxx, Best Buy, Home Depot, and restaurants just a mile up the road. Take 93 North to exit 20. Make a left at the light, and then another left into the shopping center. 9) There's no bathroom garbage pail, which I find odd, but...there is a garbage can in the room. 10) There is a parking lot in the back of the hotel for your car. I couldn't figure out how to get in or get out, or how they figured out if I was there or not. I ended up hitting the intercom buzzer to get in or out. ALL IN ALL: I recommend the hotel. No real complaints...I just want to give an honest review so that you know where you're staying.

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid”
Reviews.Author: PShermanATL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business because of the proximity to P&G and Gillette. Not a great call on my part. I got lost, called 3 times for directions, was rerouted several times (once after being hung up on) causing me to spend about 2 hours in the car. When I got to the room, they were very apologetic but the room was less than good. Cleaning was not the best, and the room smelled stale and musty. Spent $13 on internet only to discover the download speeds are so slow it took 2 hours and 40 minutes to download a 21 minute sales video. Big waste. I'm returning to Boston for a 7 day stay and I will not be booking here. The manager (Silna, I think) was extremely nice, and very apologetic, but it can't make up for a bad room. The other staff were nice as well, but still not staying here again. Plus its hard to find and very much in an odd area. $309 a night but was worth about $99.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: sshaaban26
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay there. It seemed more business focussed, but it was worth it for the price. The hotel is about a 5 min walk to the train station and a 15_20 min ride into the downtown area. There was also a free airport shuttle, and the driver was very friendly and gave me great advice for my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: baghdadlian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days during labour day weekend. When we arrived our room was ready, we were given the cookies and had to ask for the free breakfast coupons x2 even though when we booked online it stated free breakfast..the room was nice and clean....king size bed. The breakfast in the am was at the coffee shop in the main lobby and you had a choice of different meals along with 1 hot and 1 cold drink. Then they did have shuttle into Boston but you had to sign up and wait for the times they went........so we walk a 5 min walk to the T and with 2 dollars you were in downtown boston quickly. T is fast and safe even coming back from Boston late at night. They did charge for parking 10 per day. would likely come back LOVED BOSTON nicest city I have been to so far

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, Nice When Visiting The JFK Library”
Reviews.Author: CDM49
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the U of Mass University and JFK Library, we chose to stay here to see the library and then drive to Cape Cod. There is plenty of parking and it is free if you have the lobby validate your ticket. It is not within walking distance to Boston downtown, although we had no problem driving into downtown and park to walk the Freedom Trail, tour the Beacon Hill area and restaurants at night. It is also only 15 minutes from Logan Airport. The hotel does provide a shuttle to the airport and downtown. There is also a T station nearby to take downtown. Our room was nice and clean on the fifth floor, king bed and large flat screen television. The A/C was needed, but very noisy and woke us up several times during the nightâ€¦some work could be done here to improve sleeping. The hotel and local area was very lacking in restaurants, the coffee shop in the hotel was at best a poor excuse for a cafÃ© and after once never again. Now that we have visited the JFK Library and Cape Cod, we will select a hotel closer to the theater district or Commons area park the car and walk to restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not convenient to downtown attractions, etc.”
Reviews.Author: SRW262
Reviews.Content: You could not walk to anything downtown or you would be walking across highways and bad neighborhoods. However the hotel did provide a complimentary shuttle to airport, train station and downtown. Hotel could use an update - lobby was nice, but rooms were worn and dated. Bed was comfortable and room was quiet. Nice warm cookie at check-in!

Reviews.Title: “A great deal at a few subway stops from downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Seb1973
Reviews.Content: After having stayed in more expensive hotels in Downtown Boston, we decided to give this hotel a try, especially since we were not going to spend much time in our room and require more than basic amenities. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by how much we actually got for the price paid: friendly and helpful staff, convenient parking, 5 minute walk from the JFK/UMASS station unless you decide to take advantage of the free shuttle to downtown (4 times / day) and a good snack bar/cafÃ© that offered many breakfast and light lunch options as well as a convenient business centre with Internet access and printers - all free of charge. Comfortable, clean and convenient. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice views, not close to much for tourism.”
Reviews.Author: Geoff M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Labor Day weekend and really enjoyed it. The room and the staff were great. The view over the harbor was pretty good (also looked over a large empty parking lot and abandoned office building). Our only issue was that you had to take the subway (station was close by) or a cab to any of the "tourist destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: allamoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far from what you would expect from a DoubleTree. It desperately needs a remodel. You can also tell they don't wash the room well. The cover on the bed is so dirty. I found pieces of hair on the pillow. SO glad I was staying only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do the Tree”
Reviews.Author: soccermom003
Reviews.Content: I am a HiltonHonors Gold Member and this stay was my worst expereince at a Hilton property ever. This is an older dayed Hilton property< if Hilton Honors find another place to stay. A comedy of errors and issues: 1.) Hotel shuttle missed us for pick up at airport,(They did try to call my cell but couldnt hear it on the curb due to airplanes and buses) when we called we were put on hold for 19 minutes(checked my phone after call). My teenage daughter called the main number from her phone and it rang unanswered for 10 minutes.(This was at 8:30 PM, Not a way to run a brand name hotel). Finally someone came back on the line and I was told it would be an additional 30 minute wait for pick up. Paid for a cab ($40) to take my family to hotel. Told manager(Amhed) about it at check in, said if I gave him a receipt he would cover it. I did not get a receipt from the cab company after drop off. About 20 minutes after I checked in to hotel my cell phone rang, it was the front desk telling me that the shuttle was at the airport waiting for me> REALLY> 2.) Family was awaken on Sunday morning to pounding on wall at 6 AM from the fitness center treadmill on opposite wall from room. Asked front desk to move me, was told that they were sold out for the upcoming evening. They did not move me. 3.) That same evening heard a pounding noise and wall shaking on the wall from a hotel guest using the fitness center bike after 9:15 PM. Woke up my 8 yr old. The walls and beds shook. Called front desk request move, had to call down to ask staff to come up and tell the guest to stop. Next day hotel staff ackowledge that they could hear the pounding from the lobby area on the first floor. (Then why didn't they stop it!?) 4.) Requested and was granted a move the next morning to another room. 5.) The 3rd night discover that my 8 yr old pajamas were missing, contacted front desk to ask housekeeping if they mistakingly collected them while changing the linens. Received no response, went out to department store and purchased new pajamas. On a positive note, the cafe staff was friendly and offered good service. Worst Hilton stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: souriz
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this hotel AFTER I had booked (non-cancellable) and was getting worried about some of the negative comments. Well, I'm not sure what some people expect. If you pay $140 for a room, you will not get the same things as a room at $250. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Nice lobby, wonderfully pleasant staff at the check-in counter (fast service). We were given a room on the 3rd floor (324). Nice large room, a king size bed with lots of comfy pillows and clean sheets. Bathroom was very clean and had the requisite hairdryer and nice little shampoo/conditioner/cream trio. So I re-read some of the comments and if you are really fussy, yes the wallpaper is a little tired and the furniture is a little scuffed and the armchair in our room had stains on it. If it wasn't for those things, the room would probably rent out at over $200/night which we were not willing to fork out as this was just a place to sleep. We even found out the last day that we could of asked for a small refrigerator for our room (as ours did not have one). It was the only thing we found missing and all we would have had to do was ask. Some of the negative comments were regarding the shuttle services which we did not use so cannot comment (I did however witness a family at the counter very upset that the shuttle would not be recalled to pick them up when in fact they missed the pick-up time...). In any case, we would definitely recommend this hotel. Not the lap of luxury but good value for the money. You want luxury, there are lots of very expensive luxurious hotels in Boston but not at $130-$140/night.....

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient - Great Shuttle Service"”
Reviews.Author: sazzijo
Reviews.Content: We flew in from Seattle and needed a hotel to spend the nite and then take bus to Woods Hole and the ferry to Martha's Vineyard the next day. The hotel had a free shuttle which picked us up at the airport, then the next morning took us to the bus terminal. There is a subway about a block from the hotel - we took that into downtown Boston to spend the evening which worked out great. The staff was very helpful, the room clean and quiet. There is a very nice walking/jogging path along the water behind the hotel. There are no restaurants or Starbucks nearby, but if you just need a place for a layover between flights, or convenient public transportation, this is a good choice - reasonably priced. There is a small take out cafe on site. Oh...and they give you a chocolate chip cookie upon arrival - yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk service excellent, however, hotel needs a remodel.”
Reviews.Author: MemorialDay-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel about two years ago and thought it was good for the cost. We were surprised how much the room looked rundown in a mere two years. The carpet was showing it wear, the furniture was beat up, the bathroom had some pealing wallpaper and minor mildew, and the TV was an old style tube TV. (Important: if you like a hotel room that you can open the room window -- don't stay here as the windows do NOT open.) We actually shortened our stay at the hotel and moved to another hotel. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and responsive (e.g., our TV did not work and also some light bulbs were burnt out in the room, and they were quick to get these issues addressed).

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: HEISRISENFORME
Reviews.Content: I quite often turn to tripadvisor for help in making decisions on where to stay and eat while our family is on vacation. I was really worried about staying at the doubletree because of all the negative reviews but our experience was so positive that I felt it wouldn't be fair for me not to say so. From the time the free shuttle picked us up from the airport, to the mouth-watering cookies that welcomed us at our arrival to the hotel, the precious maids on the 5th floor who had a warm smile and good morning for us every day, the extremely comfortable beds, to the free shuttle back to the airport for our trip home, we very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Just a short walk to the T and you're touring Boston!

Reviews.Title: “A cheap alternative to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: daisy20071960
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a complete renovation, however, it is SPOTLESS clean and the staff is super nice. It is 5 train stops from downtown boston, and has a beautiful view of the city and the bay. Here is the consideration, do you want to pay 120.00 per night and walk 5 min to the T to be downtown, OR pay 240.00 per night and stay downtown (and still need to ride the T to get around)? I'll take the 120.00 and spend my extra money eating, drinking and shopping. Pros: Price and cleanliness Cons: No sit down restaurant and a short train ride into the city. No pool for the kids I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: eelSeattle
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Hilton family property several times before. It's not sheik but well worth the rates they charge. Very convenient to a subway station so very easy to navigate Boston. Their airport shuttle is unreliable at best but one gets what one pays for! What was supposed to be a 15-20 minute wait was in reality almost an hour. And on top of that, upon arriving for check-in, there were NO cookies! Does anyone ever recall a Doubletree running out of their signature item? However, upon complaining, management did all the proper things to ensure my return visit. The property continues to be exactly what it should be given the good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, good value, older property”
Reviews.Author: expatrick
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and the property provides an affordable option in the greater Boston area. The location is good since the Metro station is easily within walking distance and there is a bike path that goes along the bar right behind the hotel. The regular shuttle buses into downtown is also a good option for getting into the city, and a large shopping center with a Target and grocery store is about 5 minutes by car. The hotel has a Starbucks with some food options, as well as a full-service bar, but there are no other food options without having to drive or take the Metro. The hotel itself is quite outdated and has seen better days, so it's obvious why they aren't charging higher rates. However, if you are willing to accept things as they are, you can save quite a bit over the downtown hotels. When I did have problems, the staff was right there to take care of things.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and near the T (red line)”
Reviews.Author: RogAnderson
Reviews.Content: The bed was a bit on the soft side, but we slept well. Air conditioning worked perfectly. Room was simple and unfortunately we thought they hadn't cleaned the bathroom when we arrived. Turned out it was rust that made red stain along the side of the toilet. The front desk was nice but only recommended Quincy Market for food. The location is a short bus ride or 20-minute walk to the JFK Library. Everything else in the city is accessed by the T stop which is a 4-5 minute walk along a well-lit main road. Most tourist sport require a transfer downtown. There is a Starbucks in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Price”
Reviews.Author: dg909
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, and I've never slept better than I did on their bed. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, and the courtesy van from the airport was on time. If you use the transit system, it's a 5 minute walk to the station. If you're looking for new and luxurious downtown, this hotel is not for you, but if you're here to see the sights and get the most value, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “DECEPTION TO THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: turista035
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment with this hotel. For starters, they charge us twice the account. Since the month of January had made â€‹â€‹the reservation and paid in full the cost of lodging for three days. We paid a total of $ 534.oo and loaded us back $ 425.oo more. Such! like a five star hotel. This is a very, very, very bad hotel. Very poor attention in the grocery store on the first floor of the hotel. They have an older lady, very bad-looking, bad temper and so is her all the time. In the room: Dirty carpet, can not walk barefoot. The bathroom horrible. Shower not working properly, watered all the water wetting of the bathroom and towels. The broken water drain and the tub dirty, stained. The iron dirty and not working properly, which caused damage to a pant. No lights serving the room and several broken bulbs. No microwave or fridge. the cost of a microwave oven is $ 50.00 in many stores in the U.S.. Also the mini refrigerators. The TV is very old and not good programming .. The beds do not feel comfortable. The sheets are not clean and arranged on a bed so strong ... a mess! STARS FOR THIS HOTEL = 0! None. The manager, an older man, should be changed. Just broke the double role of charge in the account and said everything was fine, but lies the second charge appeared on the statement of the credit card. It is an ABUSE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Torrs1
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel and within walking distance (approx 3mins) to T station & Shaw supermarket. The rooms were very comfortable and the staff courteous. The shuttle service was prompt & very good. We had booked a room online with free breakfast vouchers - the staff did not know anything about this but honoured our request anyway. The quality of food and speed of service could be much improved.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4Family_Traveling
Reviews.Content: Big mistake to book this hotel through rent a room.com. When we got to the hotel we realized it was a dive but had prepaid so we were stuck. The hotel room was very shabby and the bathroom depressing. The only good part of staying here was the free shuttle that picked us up from the train and then took us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable location, fair price. At the end of its lifecycle”
Reviews.Author: atalanta_visitor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is becomming outdated. Our room however was fine and non of the complaints others had occured during our stay. Only discomfort was a missing light bulb and a broken one. The airco is a "classic" and makes a lot of noise. The pickup at the airport was OK. We had to wait for 15 minutes and it brought us to the hotel free of charge. During our stay we used th T tot go to town. For 2 dollar one way very cheap and only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Complementary breakfast is very limited but OK. Free wireless internet in the lobby. Once you have logged in it became free in the room as well (magic!) The shuttle back to the airport runs on the hour. It was not on a sign so we had to wait unfortunately. Very nice driver who dropped us at the rental car location instead of the airport. If you don't expect too much this is a comfortable and afordable option to stay in Boston. Sunny beaches nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, dirty hotel with extremely poor service.”
Reviews.Author: amachtay
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is that it is close to the subway. Do not depend on the hotel shuttle to pick you up, even when they say they will. There is a reason why the shuttle is free! The carpet in this place is filthy, and the elevators are extremely slow. You need to plan for 10 minutes to get from your room to the lobby, and often there is only one elevator in service. The staff is hardly helpful. Poorly managed hotel and absolutely not worth the money they charge. In fact, they should pay people to stay there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed with this Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: carole6625
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a few Doubletree hotels but this unfortunately did not match the previous standards. The front of house staff were excellent but the rooms basic and very dated which is a shame for Hilton. We were particularly disappointed with the lack of restaurant as this hotel only has a sort of take out shop with very limited food and staff that are extremely slow and reluctant to serve. In fact if you were a little late down for breakfast (which most of us are when on a holiday) there was very little food left. Because of it's out of town location there was no other food options around. However, if you can live with this and want to be out of the centre of Boston with easy access to the subway system this hotel will serve you well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, less then stellar hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mabba18
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at a suite in this hotel. It's difficult not to echo most of the other reviews. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but the room left something to be desired. The room was tidy, but not entirely clean. The rug and sofa bed had stains, and there was trash under the sofa bed. The sheets were spotless, and the beds were comfortable otherwise. The kitchen area was okay, and everything was functional. The bathroom was clean, but the shower was only partly functional (the side shower wand did not work, but not a big deal for us). We were lucky in that our room faced north, and we had an absolutely fantastic view of the city. The building itself was fine, and we had no issues with noise. As other have said, the room are in desperate need of renovation to bring them to what you would expect at other Hilton properties. The restaurant at the hotel is greatly overpriced. There are no other restaurants close by, but there is a grocery store within walking distance. A complementary breakfast would go a long way to improving the value. The best reason to choose this hotel is that it is within walking distance of a Metro stop. Choose this property over a downtown hotel at twice the price, if you can handle a somewhat poor room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hilton Standard - Shocked they passed inspection.”
Reviews.Author: libra10574
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I stay at a lot of Hilton brand properties. A LOT. I travel 50 weeks a year for business and have stayed at over 100 different Hilton brand hotels coast to coast. Typically Hampton Inns and Hilton Garden Inns, but I also stay at the occasional Doubletree or Hilton. I did something tonight that I've never done before, which is to check into a room at this hotel, then walk back to the front desk and tell them to check me out, I'm leaving. I am shocked (shocked!) that Hilton allows their name to be associated with this hotel, and have no idea how they have passed inspection (shame on the inspector -- Hilton needs to yank their brandage). It's not just that the entire room was outdated. The old, worn out carpet was stained. The one piece of upholstery was also stained. The wall vinyl seams were busting. Do not assume Hilton brand standard with this hotel. You'd be better off staying at the Hampton Inn Crosstown just a few miles away. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Not The "Standard" I Expected for a Doubletree :-(”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: Being a Hilton DIamond Member, I have stayed in Hundreds of properties in the Hilton Family, including Doubletrees. I understand that some Hotels are newer and more modern than others, but this particular property was below par in my opinion for a "Doubletree" I will start off with some positives... The staff was extremely friendly, and attentive when I needed something. The Hotel Lobby and common areas were very nice. The little restaurant deli in the lobby area was nice as well. Upon check in I went to my room and was a little underwhelmed by the decor. Very dated. My room had 3 pieces of furniture on the wall, all mismatched. The TV (not a flat screen, but an old large tube television ) was sitting on top of an old 3 drawer dresser that was beat up and looked like most of the finish was worn off. Next to that a dark table to hold the coffee service, and then the desk. OH, and a fridge just sitting in the floor against the wall. The wall paper on the walls was coming apart at the seams and looked old too. After getting things unpacked, etc, I notice that next to the floor lamp there is a big empty space where I assumed a chair should be, since there was no where to sit and watch tv except on the bed. I called the desk, and after a little back and forth was told " yes, you should have a chair.. we'll bring one up" Well, they did bring me a chair. Not in the best shape, but at least a chair was now in my room. Also I will say the bed was very soft, and not the firm sweetdreams bed I have found in other Doubletrees. Lastly, being a diamond member I was given Free Internet Access to which I see others on here saying they had to pay.. but I must say it was some of the slowest internet I have ever found in a hotel. and only wireless, so I could not hardwire in to see if it was faster. If I had paid for it, I would have been highly upset and asked for a refund. It was painful. My last night there, around 11 PM, every light in my room went out. Not the power, just the lights. Even the bathroom. I called the desk, and she sent maintenance up to check it out. He could not figure out why the lights just went out. While he was there, the floor lamp popped on, and so he suggested I take that lamp into the bathroom to shower in the morning until someone can come fix it. I told him I was checking out in the morning anyway, and that carrying a lamp in the bathroom was unacceptable. So I called and spoke to the desk manager and just told him my disappointment in the stay and the no light situation. He sent me up a key to another room down the hall so I could go use that bathroom the next morning. Not ideal, but at least I had something. The manager also did credit me for that nights stay due to the inconvenience. Again staff was great, no complaints there. Rooms just need updating, a real scrub down cleaning, and beds updated as well. I just felt as though this hotel was "old" and not up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: BizTravlerJunky
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, the front desk did not acknowledge my Hilton Honors Membership. I did however have two water bottles sitting in front of my door. I wasn't even on the Hilton Honor Member specific floor. Hotel room doors wouldn't lock automatically. You could literally push the door open without the keycard. Requested to move to another room and was put in another room on the same floor that smelled like old chicken wings and smoke. Requested again to be moved to another room and FINALLY got a decent room on a different floor. Parking was $10/day and the gate wasn't working but was 'in repair' according to the front desk. Did I mention that internet wasn't free? Location was near a T station but didn't feel safe walking around in the neighborhood the hotel was in. The free cookie was delicious. The "one" perk of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel but clean and friendly and very noisy! (walls are paper-thin)”
Reviews.Author: corylei
Reviews.Content: Pros: - staff are very friendly and helpful - rooms are clean - free Doubletree cookies - free shuttle is handy for airport users and those using rail at South Station Cons: - rooms are old (wallpaper is coming off in some areas) - walls are paper-thin; can hear conversations in the corridor and other rooms very clearly - as if there was no wall at all - bathroom is like a sauna (very poor ventilation) - wifi is $13 a day - business centre is old; keyboard was broken and computers are slow - breakfast is very average

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but had all we needed”
Reviews.Author: LauraTay
Reviews.Content: My husband had a last minute work trip to Boston and his employers were happy for me to join him. We spent 10 days at the hotel, my husband only having to work one day so the rest was spent as a holiday. The hotel was quite basic but staff were very helpful and friendly and it had very easy access to the T to get into the City. We only really slept in the hotel as we wanted to see as much of Boston as possible so spent very little time at the hotel. We ate breakfast in the cafe which was lovely and always went to the small but very comfortable bar for a drink before bed.The bedrooms were clean and spacious. We did use the fittness room that was very useful, please be aware this is not a gym and only a small room however it has everything you need for a work out and was never busy. I also really liked the fact that you could go out of the back of the hotel across the car park and you were on the beach, I went for a run along the boardwalk each morning and this was lovely as you had views of the boston skyline. Overall I will say I have stayed in more luxorious hotels in America however it was all we needed and very comfortable. We really enjoyed Boston and I will be accompanying my husband on another business trip/ holiday this year.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline $50 night--good deal for decent hotel in lame location”
Reviews.Author: Tar Heel Bill 92
Reviews.Content: I had business in/around Boston in December 2010 and was also visiting friends in Milton, so I used priceline.com to bid for a hotel in the South Boston vicinity--and got the Doubletree Club Boston Bayside for a mere $50 for my one night. All in all, it was a decent Doubeltree in a not great location in Boston, generally, but it worked great for me. Especially for just $50 a night. The hotel is definitely not on the beaten path if you are doing any tourist activities or business in central Boston. It is about 10-15 minutes south of the Boston Airport, so it's convenient to reach from there if that's a priority. But there's not much nearby--it feels like a relatively isolated business park area, really. The hotel is a solid Doubeltree. My room was nice and average size. The bed was fine--Sheraton and Westin have better beds, in my opinion. The TV was a regular boob tube as opposed to the flat screen. Bathroom fair. All in all, a reasonably average business hotel...and a nice deal for $50. If I were traveling for fun, I'd never stay here unless there was a fantastic deal and I was only meeting friends/seeing things south of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JennM021
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle service from/to airport (you do need to call ahead for them to pick you up @ Logan & sign up for the shuttle service back to the airport). 2 blocks or so away from T stop. Grocery store within walking distance. Although there are no restaurants close by, the front desk had a large selection of take-out menus. Staff was friendly & helpful. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: holly75104
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when UFC was in Boston and paid the room through bookit prior to our arrival. When I checked in the clerk asked for my debit/credit card and then proceeded to "accidently" charge me 3 nights after he had seen the room was already paid. He stated the charges would immediately be returned to my card. WRONG. It was not until the next week and after calls to the manager that I got my money back. And during my stay, things were stolen from my room. I vowed to never stay here again. So why am I writing now 3 months later? I have not traveled since September and this morning I look at my bank acct and this hotel has taken $386+ out of my account. I have tried to contact the manager, accounting.. anyone to help me for the past 5hrs and no one is there. I have even called the corporate office. SO, needless to say, I will never use another Doubletree/Hilton period, not just this one. Especially since I know it is that easy to use my card without my permission months later. My bank has advised me to cancel my card as soon as my money is returned and I will definately do so just to make sure they never charge me again.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: 40Acres
Reviews.Content: Pros: Since I was giving at talk at UMass Boston the next day you couldn't beat the location. Very comfy bed. Good temp and light control. Cons: odd parking situation (some "free" spots out front, lot out back with tickets and gate that didn't exactly work but you buzzed and they let you out). And I'm not usually that picky but mold on tub and cracked sink in a hotel at this level surprised me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value clean and close to a T”
Reviews.Author: Ikorel
Reviews.Content: Great Shuttle service to the airport, close to JFK/UMASS T Stop. Rooms are big and clean, everything works, generally good value. Internet access is not free apart from in the lobby, but if you leave laptop on after you have connected, it does stay connected in your room.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel - lousy location”
Reviews.Author: conceptual
Reviews.Content: the hotel has, as most doubletree hotels, no charm at all - but the rooms are clean and comfortable. there's a coffee machine, some good cosmetic products, and great not-too-soft beds. but be warned about the LOCATION! there are three (!!!) mount vernon streets in boston, and google maps is most likely showing you the downtown mount vernon street - and so was our gps! the "doubletree club boston bayside" is NOT in downtown, but in a quite ugly suburban setting, no cafes or shops around, and very deserted at night. boston is a city that needs to be witnessed from inside, so i'd recommend everyone to look for a downtown hotel. by the way, be warned: the wireless in the rooms comes with an additional cost, so does the hotel parking!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: joleejack
Reviews.Content: The downtown hotels were too expensive so we took a chance on this Doubletree. What a great move! Although smaller with fewer ammenities, it was just the right match for our sightseeing 4 days and nights in Boston. We walked to the JFK Library--a must see. The Tstation was 2 blocks from the hotel, and we took off on different colored lines each day. Cambridge was gorgeous, Little Italy was scrumptios, Fenway Park, Freedom Trail, Fannieul Market. Don't miss the Prudential Tower SkyWalk...a great view and an interesting museum. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer. They provide free shuttles to the dowtown Doubletree and free airport shuttles. We saw some of the hotels downtown that we had considered---nice, but noisy and crowded. The hotel even made a special trip to the airport for us after some botched plans--they were the best. We'd stay here again. No restuarant on site, but a Central Market with fresh salads, soups, a couple entrees and a variety of breakfast food and snack. Oh yes,..a bar is open in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: valery11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon to Boston. It was so great, much more so than I expected! It is within walking distance of a public transportation station. We were able to see everything we wanted to without having to speand any money on a cab or rent a car, The staff was super friendly, and very helpful. There was a restaurant in the hotel that was great for breakfast, but for most other meals we were out of the hotel. The bed was comfortable, and there were lots of pillows ( a big deal for me) Also, compared to the prices of the other hotels in and around Boston this one was very inexpensive, and we were only a few train stops from anything we wanted to see. Perfect Perfect Perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, lousy smell”
Reviews.Author: Pool-Mom5
Reviews.Content: Cross the back parking lot and take a lovely stroll along the bay. The room was dated but had a nice tv and bedding. The frig. was a nice addition. But the mold & mildew smell in the bathroom combined with an HVAC unit louder than an airplane engine just wrecked it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Leenie116
Reviews.Content: The bed was the best part of this hotel- very comfortable. Waited quite a while for service at the front desk. The breakfast was awful and way overpriced for the poor quality of this food. It was reasonably priced which is what we wanted, so I guess we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it here”
Reviews.Author: sheltercove
Reviews.Content: When in Boston my wife and I usually stay on the outskirts of Boston to get a cheaper rate. Our only necessity is that we are close to a T stop. Lately we have been staying at the Holiday Inn Express on Boston Street. It is close to the Andrew stop on the red line. We have been happy there. It gets good reviews on Trip Advisor. So, for the purpose of this review, I will draw comparisons between the Double tree and the HIE. When we fly into Boston we head straight for the T machine in B terminal. We get our 7 day link passes which are a bargain at 15 dollars. We take the silver line to South Station. From there we took the red line to the JFK UMASS stop. It is the next stop after Andrew. The hotel is a very short walk from the T stop. It is closer to the T stop than the HIE is from the Andrew stop. The hotel is not really that attractive from the outside. The lobby is quite large when you enter the hotel. There is a small bar, a deli counter, small computer room with two computers. The lobby has some comfortable chairs and sofas in it. The nod on the lobby area goes to the Double Tree. We arrived before check in time and were immediately given our room keys. The room was large with a nice flat screen tv. The bathroom was also of a good size with plenty of hot water. The towels were really thick. Each bed had five pillows on it. My wife is a real pillow freak so she was in heaven. We each slept well. We heard no noise from the rooms next door. Once again the room experience goes to the Double Tree. The HIE offers a free breakfast while the Double Tree does not. Their food offerings are on the limited side. The nod goes to the HIE here. There are really no restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. The HIE has a few. The nod goes to the HIE here also. We have never seen a friendlier group of cleaning staff workers then we did at the Double Tree. They all said hello whenever they saw you. The staff and the desk seemed both friendly and efficient. We were able to walk to the JFK library. It was a 15 minute walk from the hotel. If this seems too far there is a free shuttle which runs from the T stop. There is a Shaw's supermarket located near the T stop. It seemed to get a large amount of people who walked to and from the market. My wife and I had enough Hilton honors points to get two free nights here. After reading the trip advisor reviews I told her that we should not expect too much. I was very pleased at how much I liked the hotel. In the future we would pay to stay here if the price is right. I think the people who complain about the hotel not being close to town and activities should do a little more research before they book. If you want to be downtown then be prepared to pay downtown prices. If you are resourceful and don't mind riding the T and doing a little walking then save some money and stay here. One more thing. If you walk through the large parking lot behind the hotel you will be on the water. This is a great place to take a long walk. You can walk the Carson beach area and you almost feel that you are at the seashore. Probably very cold in the winter months though.

Reviews.Title: “Staff better than advertised, location not.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFloyd
Reviews.Content: My experience with the shuttle service and the staff in general was much better than described in other reviews. My wait for the shuttle at Logan was no more than 10 minutes and the return was right on time. The drivers were fine as were the front desk staff. Furthermore, I was able to get into my room at 10 am. On the other hand, I concur with the other reviews regarding the hotel's location. Aside from the JFK T-stop being only a few minutes walk away, the is nothing else nearby. Furthermore the dining options at the hotel are extremely limited. Lastly, they charge for in-room wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more in Boston - you'll be happy you did”
Reviews.Author: swankyflyer
Reviews.Content: The biscotti cookie from the cafe is excellent - you may want to swing by and get one if you're headed to U Mass or the JFK Library - but other than that, you may want to spend more for a room in Boston. I was in Boston working with two nonprofit organizations and need to be careful about r expenses since my client will be reimbursing me. It seemed that $300-$400/night for a room in Boston was crazy - I've never had to pay that amount before, but this week the hotel rates in town were at least 50% more than usual. The Doubletree Bayside was $189/night - $216 with taxes and fees. I'm a Diamond level guest at the Hilton Brand hotels but my experience was no gem! I had a freeway-side room for 3 nights and never say the bay until I was waiting for the elevator on the 5th floor. When I checked in at 5:00 PM there was construction activity in the room above me which concluded at 6:00 PM. I was told that they were remodeling a "view room" and that they would be done that day (which was true). Still, why was I put in a room near construction? The bathroom sink is cracked, the desk chair was so uncomfortable that it was actually causing me pain (which they changed out the next day for a different chair), I slept in the very middle of the king bed because it is apparently so old, it has two 'body dents' from everyone that has slept there before me. While the hotel enticed me the ability to get dinner and breakfast onsite, the reality is a sandwich and salad shop with premade eggs, lots of bread and nothing hot to eat for dinner. Don't think you'll just step out and walk to dinner - oh no! There is no where to go. I was given a pizza menu, an asian take out menu and "homemade food" menu which turned out to be pizza and seafood but nothing quite "homemade". In desperation I called a nearby restaurant and ordered delivery - later I spend sometime in the bathroom relieving myself of a dinner that clearly did not take.............. The business center is a very small room with two computers that run the speed of a snail. I couldn't print my boarding pass from one so I had to start the airline check-in and boarding pass print process again from the other..... Both mornings of my early stay I woke up early and got online to see if I could get another hotel room somewhere else in town....... all booked for the week. I'll certainly stay elsewhere next time. That's sad because I am a faithful Hilton traveler, but this experience certainly changes my opinion of the Hilton brand in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “You are not a priority for their shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: MountaineerTwin
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the recent ICAAC meeting at the Waterfront Convention Center. Although it had the potential to be a positive experience, the most disappointing part of the stay was poor shuttle service. I felt like a second class citizen compared to the Amtrak staff who were given priority. I called for a ride from the airport and the driver came in 15 minutes. This was relatively quickly compared to the other couple we picked up who said they were waiting 45 minutes. The real problem for me started when we pulled into a dark alley by the Amtrak station. We were given no explanation other than it would just be a few minutes. After 30 minutes and several phone calls by the driver, the Amtrak staff arrived. We could have been to the hotel and back in the time we waited. I would have taken a taxi if I knew we were going to wait to fill the van. When booking for the conference I was under the impression that the meeting would have motorcoaches shuttle attendees to the convention center. Apparently this service was cancelled due to low numbers but the hotel agreed to shuttle attendees instead. That was a good attempt at customer service, but the van only held 11 people and often there were 20 or more waiting to attend morning sessions. With departures only on the hour, I made a reservation but it made no difference because the driver said it was "first come, first serve". I tried to call a taxi, but it took 20 minutes to arrive because of the distant location from downtown. Granted this hotel was by far the cheapest associated with the conference, but I would have looked elsewhere if I knew in advance that the shuttle service would be so horrible. The rooms are nothing special, and the cafe is ok but there is nothing else to eat within walking distance. The train station is nearby but requires a transfer to reach the convention center so I will not be staying here again for a meeting at the Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get into downtown Boston but away from any good action.”
Reviews.Author: KCBram
Reviews.Content: I would have preferred to stay in downtown Boston where all the action is but the price at this hotel was more in my budget. However, to get into downtown it was very easy. It is just a 4 - 8 minute walk to train, depending on how much traffic there was you had to cross over. Apparently, the hotel shuttle goes between their location and the downtown location a few times a day. So, you could sign up for that but the train was very easy that we didn't bother with the shuttle. Speaking of the hotel shuttle...The driver I had to and from the airport was horrible. Not a personable fellow but that is okay it was more the return from the hotel to the airport that made me regret not reporting him to the hotel management right way. He was talking on his cell phone the entire time. Some states that is illegal to do! He was also not wearing a seatbelt. So, every five minutes or so the beeping sound would ring for about 30 seconds to remind him to buckle up but I guess he could not hear it cause he was so involved in that cell phone call. I felt real safe when he got a call in on his walkie-talkie about another pick up he needed to make so at this point he has his cell in one hand sort of half way holding onto the steering wheel and the walkie-talkie in the other. I regret not taking a picture of all this action as directly behind him was a sign posted to the riders..."buckle up!" OK, so bad hotel shuttle driver but I am sure they have others that I hope you get. The fact that it is free is a nice feature the hotel offers but I had to wait 35 minutes for it to show up and then it took about 30 to get to the hotel as it made additional stops at the Amtrak station. I suggest calling for a pick up as soon as you step off the plane. If you want to visit the John F. Kennedy library, which I recommend, this hotel is very convenient for that. You just walk to the closest train station from the hotel where a free bus picks up every 20 minutes and then the library/museum is just 10 minutes away. The hotel rooms were very tight - two double beds in the room and that was about all that fit. Like the Au Bon Pain in the hotel as it was easy to grab something fast for breakfast to take on into downtown where we really wanted to be. Free wi-fi in the lobby, not in rooms, that it looked like a lot of people were taking advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashion hotel, far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Jorgepab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 60-70Â´s hotel not upgraded since then... It is old fashioned and not modernised... The rooms are hughe and the beds awesome, but the rest of the hotel could be avoided... Definitvely a good spot if you are visiting something close but nothing to do if what you want to see is boston itself. Also, the breakfast is in a kind of small cafeteria and a bit expensive... Not a hotel for a brand as hilton... I wouldnÂ´t recomend unless you need to work close by...

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gina021
Reviews.Content: The hotel had average, clean rooms and comfortable linens. We had an Expedia deal that included free breakfast - a nice bonus - in the hotel restaurant, Au Bon Pain. Parking was cheap - $10 a day with in/out privileges. There is no free WiFi in the rooms, only in the lobby. The location was not good at all. Sort of in the ghetto. There was absolutely nothing around except the U-Mass campus and JFK Library. No shopping or restaurants. You need to take the subway to go anywhere, and the nearby subway stop is a bit creepy. I personally wouldn't feel comfortable going to that stop alone. The hotel offers a free shuttle to downtown about every 4 hours which you need to make a reservation for. We never took it because it didn't drop off where we wanted to go. If you do decide to stay here, it is kind of difficult to find at first. Here's a clue - follow the signs to the Expo Center - it's right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: cptx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to downtown with a subway station just a 5 minute walk away. The hotel is nice with friendly and helpful staff. No restaurants in the immediate area but shuttles are available to good restaurants within a couple of miles. Airport shuttle is very convenient. The only spoiler was the restaurant. It is more like poor quality airport fast food, disappointing for an otherwise good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just ok for a doubletree”
Reviews.Author: zoedude
Reviews.Content: it was very convient to get to from New Jersey, and I was impressed with the front desk . Check in very easy, woman was so very helpful getting us to the 'T', and helping us figure out which stops we needed. I was impressed with the bed, linens and pillows- i don't think I ever slept so well. Now for the things that went wrong- the carpet was filthy-coffee, what looked like grape juice and some kind of grease stains. I wore socks after seeing the bottom of my bare feet were brown.There was hair in bathtub and on the shower walls- black hair, and I'm blonde. The tiles in the shower were in serious need of grout, the sink was lacking caulking and the tolet ran all night. There was a $10 parking fee in a scary parking lot in back with no security or a fence around it- although it was well lit. A $12.95 fee for internet seems rather steep, most places offer free internet. Also when I booked the room online, I asked for a refrigerator to keep medication cold, and of course, no refirgerator. Thankfully I travel with a cooler! No swimming pool, no restaurant onsite or nearby, rather seedy neighborhood to get to the 'T', so definatly not a place to bring children.Would I stay here again? No way

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel with sizeable rooms”
Reviews.Author: nsIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Doubletree Club Boston Bayside in June 2010 for 5 nights. Upon arrival at Boston Logan airport I contacted the hotel and they sent a complimentary shuttle bus to collect myself and my colleague within 20 minutes. The hotel itself is a little dated, and is located 15-30 minutes away from Downtown (depending on how heavy the traffic is). The hotel offer a complimentary shuttle to Downtown approximately 6 times per day, and they also collect residents Downtown and bring them back to the hotel. The complimentary airport shuttle bus leaves on the hour every hour. The downsides of this hotel are the cafe (there is no restaurant onsite) and the fact that the location is not within walking distance of any places to eat (that I could find). During the weekend there were a lot of children running up and down the hallways, which if you like to get to sleep before 11pm, could be irritating (maybe I was just unlucky on the weekend I visited!). The rooms did not offer much sound-proofing and I could often hear my neighbour's television. If you are using this hotel as nothing more than a crash pad, the beds are comfortable and the rooms are sizeable. They offer free WiFi in the lobby, and there is a business centre which has 2 PC's and 2 printers. However, if like me you like a good nights sleep, I would recommend choosing another hotel if your trip includes the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for! Room contained...”
Reviews.Author: TravellerforBusiness
Reviews.Content: Get what you pay for! Room contained holey linen (not from the heavens), water damaged ceiling, most fellow guests appeared to be large tours. We wanted cheap but safe overnight 'n that's what we got. Cranky front desk staff but onsite Cafe Au Bon Pain staff and products just fab.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but does its job”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay57
Reviews.Content: This is your typical run of the mill hotel. Comfortable beds, average rooms, friendly clerks. Parking is $10 which is too much considering the creepy parking lot. There is a t-station right nearby, but it's in a horrible part of town. It is nerve racking to walk even from the hotel to the station. There is an Au Bon Pain in the lobby, but it takes at least 20 minutes to get served because it is also open to the public, and is extremely busy. No serious complaints, but I wouldn't recommend this as a place for young children because the area is too sketchy. No free internet or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a little outside of the city”
Reviews.Author: countryskipper
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is really nice and a good value for the money. It is close to the subway and even with a cab it does not take very long to get into town, but this is by no means a city location. They have a shuttle to the airport. You can buy breakfast in a while coffeeshop downstairs and it's pretty good. It was a little loud on our floor, but that might not be the norm. Overall, I think it's a good hotel if you don't need/want to stay in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but there's a reason it's cheaper”
Reviews.Author: dccd14
Reviews.Content: After careful reviews of the area I booked myself and a colleague here since we were going to the nearby Mass Convention Center. The rate is under $200 where nearby places are $200-$400+. Location is great especially for the convention center, and while the beds seem okay, the lobby smelled very musty, there were water stains in the room, the furniture is stained, and what the heck is that on the ceiling (see pic)?!?!? I will need to get housekeeping to take wahtever that is away! Not off to a good start - and I am a Hilton Honors member whcih wasn't even mentioned by the front desk. I got the same nice warm cookie everyone gets, but so far I am not impressed. It's true that you usually get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “College search Trip”
Reviews.Author: kybammer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a college search trip for my daughter because it modest cost and was a five minute walk to the Boston T (mass transit system). Rooms were standard size with comfortable double beds. There is a distinct lack of restaurants in the area. We found it necessary to take the T into downtown Boston to have a nice meal. (Though Amrheins is near by and is recommended for a very nice meal of classic American Cuisine.) The staff was helpful and went out of their way to assist us when our luggage was lost by the airline. The hotel took us to a local shopping area to get "supplies". The hotel has a shuttle that runs hourly to and from Logan International making your flights. There is a Au Bon Pain deli in the hotel lobby that is the hotel restaurant. A separate full bar is also off of the lobby with several TVs playing the local and national sports.

Reviews.Title: “Okay choice if location works for you”
Reviews.Author: Conraveler
Reviews.Content: Advantages - Relatively clean - Economical - On-site (but disorganzied) Au Bon Pan open for breakfast, lunch and dinner - Nearby restaurant offers free van service - Small bar - Limited hotel shuttle - Relatively fast cab service - Helpful front desk - ATM Disadvantages - Really need a car or take a short walk to the "T" since not much is in walking distance - Rooms are a little worn but still work - Public areas are more worn - HVAC blows right on desk work area - Slow Internet in business center

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SaltLakeCityStuart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights to participate in the Boston Marathon. I was able to check in upon arrival at 9 am after a red eye flight. The staff was friendly and helpful. The shuttle driver picked me up at the airport with no difficulty what-so-ever. My room looked out at the bay, and was close to a little beach, and the JFK Library. Great for walking around or running. The hotel is very close to the Red "T-line", and downtown Boston is only 4 T stops away (10 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are driving a car”
Reviews.Author: doug3909
Reviews.Content: While the room's accommodations were OK, you park your car in the hotel parking facility at risk of the car being vandalized. My brand new rental car was "keyed" along the entire driver's side. I could not see any video cameras in the parking facility. I have yet to receive an apology from the hotel. In fact, I have yet to receive any communication from hotel management even though a report was written. They charged $10 per night for parking. There are too many nicer hotels in the Boston area to take a chance on this one.

Reviews.Title: “worst hilton family property i've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jt24
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Diamond memeber, and have stayed at Hilton properties all over the country. With the exception of one Hampton Inn in rural Georgia, this is the worst experience I've had. Rude employees, old room with a 27" tv from the mid 90's, and a dirty small bathroom. Also, $13 a night for internet... This is the first time I've been charged for internet service. I traded in my free breakfasts to get internet, but as a Diamond member I can't remember the last time i didn't get both. I've tried to switch hotels, but there is some event in Boston that has me stuck here unless I'm willing to buck up another $200+ a night. This stay is making me consider leaving Hilton for good, and staying at Marriott properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park and Fly Hotel - Excellent Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: Stonington-Sue
Reviews.Content: When I look through the other reviews, some of them make me wonder if we stayed at the same place!! Our room was immaculate, clean, spacious with coffee machine and TV with the usuals. The desk staff couldn't have been more helpful - very pleasant and we enjoyed our warm cookie on arrival very much! Let's be clear - this hotel isn't downtown, but, as has been mentioned in other reviews the T Station is very close. It was perfect for us to leave our car there while we were away and on the right side of town for easy access to the I-95. The shuttle service was prompt and timely and we called them from baggage pick-up at Boston Logan and they were waiting for us with a nice warm van on our return - perfect! No, there's no breakfast or restaurant - just Au Bon Pain - so somewhere to get a coffee and a snack - again helpful staff. The server went and got us coffee from the staffroom as they'd just closed as we got back - beyond the call of duty I say! I might not stay here if I was "doing" Boston - but then again - where can you park the car downtown? That Red Line is so handy - hmmm, conundrum that one!!

Reviews.Title: “Up all night!”
Reviews.Author: smilineddie
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls. Very loud, rude people in the next room kept us up all night. Doors were slamming late at night, then too early in the morning. We have never had to pay for internet access. No restaurant worth mentioning and none nearby. Doubletree used to be a quality hotel name to us, but after our experience we will never stay in a Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Good package for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: sharathmika
Reviews.Content: We had planned a bus trip to Washington D.C. I live in New Hampshire. My in-laws had come to visit me from India. So We had to stay in Boston for a night before taking the morning bus. This was the least expensive room that I could find for 4 of us to stay. Surprisingly the room was quite big and comfortable. There were frequent buses to Boston downtown. The hotel is also well connected to the sub ways. The only thing that did not please me was there was no free Wi-Fi. The hotel staffs were quite helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for seeing Boston”
Reviews.Author: ski&brew
