Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close enough to the Red line to make it a great value as a base for seeing Boston. The low rate had me concerned until I arrived and experienced the hotel. The Red line station (JFK library /UMass Boston) can be seen from the front of the hotel, and is less then a 5 minute walk. There is one roadway underpass that you must walk under get back to the hotel. This is not a residential section of Boston and there were not any locals just hanging around so I felt pretty secure making this walk at night. The hotel is located right next to the Bayside Expo center so is very convenient if you have a reason to be at the expo. I guess the price goes up when there is an expo event. This hotel does not have a pool. The lobby is looking old. The room was large and clean. Front desk staff was very nice and easy to work with. Parking costs $10. No good place to eat near the hotel except the high priced Au Bon Pain in the hotel lobby. I suggest breakfast at South Station or Downtown Crossing which is where the red line takes you.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Happy With This One”
Reviews.Author: kimolsen
Reviews.Content: No breakfast included and the wireless is really expensive; however, the shuttle service was great. They picked us up at the airport and also at the downtown Doubletree and brought us back at night outside of the normal scheduled hours, just call the hotel and they radio the driver, if he is around, he will come and get you. Make sure you sign up in advance to use the shuttle. The Upperdeck Trolley company comes to the hotel every morning and picks you up if you are interested in their city tour, which I recommend. The room was nice although the walls are too thin. This wasn't a problem until our last night and we heard everything in the next room. For the price I paid with AAA discount, this was worth the money. Although we didn't use, it is close to the T station although you have to cross a busy street which is torn up right now with construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Budgettravel99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Very happy with the service. Took about 20 minutes, maybe less to get downtown using the train - including the walk to the station. Felt very safe in the area as it is mostly a college area. As other reviews have mentioned the Au Bon Pain on site is not worth your time. But the coffee in the room was good and they were happy to give me more at the front desk. For the price it is worth it to stay here and travel in to the downtown area. Used the free shuttle to the downtown Doubletree once. Do not recommend. They stop to pick up and drop off Amtrack employees - it took 40 minutes to get to the other hotel. Oh, the shower head was very low. Fine for me but not for someone tall.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to downtown”
Reviews.Author: bigfitz79
Reviews.Content: Short walk to JFK/UMass train station gives easy access to and from downtown. Prices were much better than downtown. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable with lots of pillows. Airport shuttle made for an easy depature.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - A little stretched truth, but for the price, ok”
Reviews.Author: eelfromdfw
Reviews.Content: We were traveling for a business trip for my husband and brought our 2 teenaged kids with us. We requested a cot at check in as well as prior to arrival and were not told there would be a charge for it - which there was upon checkout. Staff member who brought cot to our room was very friendly. Online, the website for the hotel says parking is complimentary, yet there was a charge for that also. The website also says it's across the street from the Red T line (subway) - we wanted to spend the afternoon touring Fenway and browsing Faneuil Hall and this was the most economincal way to make that happen, transportation wise. It is definitely not across the street, but a 5-10 minute walk along a very busy street and no way would we walk while it was dark to the T. The rooms were a bit musty. It is next to the Bayside Expo center which was nice. The photos showed a water view and we had no idea where that was at - it was nowhere we could see from the hotel. Getting a hotel under 150 at this caliber during the week can be tough in Boston, so the 134 rate was welcomed. We probably would not stay here again, but if you want just an overnight stay for an early Logan flight, this would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Good economical choice for Boston”
Reviews.Author: WashState
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pleasant. It was a short walk to the T and the staff was nice. There is a shuttle to/from airport and South Station which was very nice. We arrived on an early morning flight and were very pleased to be able to have the shuttle pick us up and let us check in early (before 9 am). The furnishings were a bit worn but room was clean. There was a slight musty odor but that dissipated after a couple of hours. We took a train out the next day and the shuttle drove us to South Station, much easier than trying to lug bags on the T.

Reviews.Title: “hot chocolate cookies”
Reviews.Author: allstates
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about the free shuttle from the airport,but sure enough fifteen minuete wait and our ride arrived.The welcome from the front desk was appreciated after a long flight.The hotel has a pleasant feel to it,we went into town the next morning at 9.00am on the shuttle bus ,it dropped us of at the downtown doubletree its an easy walk to the start of the freedom trail.We got back at 8.00pm the hotel phoned for the shuttle,we had a snack and a drink then went back to the hotel.The hotel has a breakfast shop in the lounge area very nice after breakfast back into town.The next day we once again used the shuttle service back to the airport to collect the hire car for the next stage of our trip.I saved three days car rental,we also used the tube(T)to get around town its very good.The stay at the doubletree was excellent for an out of town hotel ,they could not have done anymore.Yes they did we had hot choc cookies when we arrived and when we left. You must eat in Quincy market(Faneul hall)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ase78
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good, good clean room. Not close to town but easy accessibel by train. No breakfast included however they have a small breakfast shop inside the hotel. Very bad service and food. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Stayed”
Reviews.Author: Imiloa
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant at first, but once we became familiar with the terrain, we left the car in the parking lot and just walked and rode the train everywhere. The inhouse deli was convenient, but closes too early. Enjoyed their soups. Best food deal is at Shaws down the road. Kennedy Library and U.Mass. are an easy flat walk away. Only negative thing was the road construction going on near the train station intersection. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: pininfarina575
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and her mother with 7 heavy luggage bags came (with luggage for moving into college dorm) and no one helped them out. The shuttle driver didn't help them load the bags onto the shuttle nor to get them off the shuttle. No bellboy came to help the two ladies out. I called them myself, and the receptionist's tone was the complete opposite of friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation for Boston, MA”
Reviews.Author: meghna1850
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had half a day in Boston. We walked around Boston Commons park where there were all sorts of activities for the young and old. We had a drink at Cheers which is across from the park. We took an antique limo tour (which we found out about from an information center at the park). This was an awesome tour, it was not as pricey as the other tours, not as long as the other tours (this helped us because we were short on time). And because it was a car, it was just my 2 friends and me and the driver, and with his car he was able to go through all the little streets and show us more than the other tours could've. He even stopped at Mike's pastry shop for us so we can grab some of the famous pastries. He picked us up and dropped us off at our location of choice. We didn't get to see all of Harvard, but what we did see was impressive. We stayed at Doubletree Club-Bayside on Mt. Vernon street which was a nice hotel but horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel close to the T, far from everything else”
Reviews.Author: nycpoetess
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice. Once Memorial Day Weekend 2008 and then again in September to check out Grad school programs. The rooms are a little run down, but they aren't terrible and are decent sized. Some of the staff is sooooo nice, other staff members are a little flaky. They do have an local/airport shuttle, the front desk clerk was nice enough to arrange for me to be dropped of at South Station to catch the Amtrak. There is free internet in the lobby. This hotel is not for vacation, its sufficient for a short stay in Boston when you want pay less than $150 per night. I prefer to stay close to the Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eaglemaniac
Reviews.Content: I found Boston hotels quite expensive, so we chose this from reviews. We found it to be clean and even though the location was out in the suburbs, we didn't find it to be a hassle at all. We walked to the JFK Library along the harbour and got a free ride into the city the next day for our tours. The train back to the hotel was no hassle, so the hotel suited us. We ordered a meal in and it was delivered to our room with no hassles. The staff were friendly and we'd stay here again without blinking. It was good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: scottishblondie
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at this hotel at the moment. I decided to make a stop in Boston on the way home from a conference in Huntsville, and booked my flights a week apart without looking at the prices of hotels in Boston. I nearly had a heart attack when I saw how expensive Boston is, but found Doubletree Bayside for $119 a night, which was within my budget. A friend had stayed here last year, so I also felt reassured that it wouldn't be a total dump! Upon arrival at Logan Airport I found that they don't have a button on the courtesy bus panel, but the man at the information desk allowed me to use the phone there to call the hotel. The shuttle arrived in 15 minutes and found me no bother. When I got the to the hotel the guy on the desk offered me a free upgrade to a king room, but not until the next day. I said yes (it was after midnight so I was just going to sleep anyway) However the girl on the desk the next day didn't seem to understand about the upgrade, so I didn't bother forcing the issue. The room itself is on the 3rd floor, facing the front. It is kind of noisy, I'm not sure if it's road noise or from air conditioning units either side, but it's a dull roar that doesn't really bother me. What does bother me however is the stale smoke smell every time I come into the room. I assume that this used to be a smoking room and it hasn't been redecorated since. The whole hotel could use a bit of an overhaul, but it isn't falling apart or anything. I've seen other reviewers say that there isn't anything within walking distance, but I woukd point out that there is a beach, the JFK Library and just down from the T stop is a Shaws supermarket and an off-license. There aren't any restaurant type places that I've found, but there is a Chinese that delivers til 1am (not the best tho) and the "cafe" in the lobby, which reguarly closes early and is pretty overpriced, so I've been getting most of my meals at Quincy Market in downtown (Aquarium or State T stops). If you have a week travel pass ($15 for 7 days versus $2 a ride otherwise) it isn't much bother to hop on the train and go into town (25 minutes or so including walking time). There is free wi-fi in the lobby and a business centre, but the in-room wi-fi is totally overpriced at $12.95 per 24 hours (August 2009). They don't mind you sitting in the lobby with a laptop though, and there are at least 4 or 5 people doing just that every night. I'd still recommend it to my friends as we're all pretty poor, but overall I'd say if you've got more available, fork out for somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Site for Us!”
Reviews.Author: teehatch
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel every month or so for a 1 to 2 night stay. Our daughter abd son-in-law live in Savin Hill - the next T stop from the JFK Library station so this is very convenient. We drive in from theother end of the state and can get to the supermarket arond the corner very easily. We enjoy riding the T to get around the city. Visited the Gardener Museum this trip. We usually use the AAA rate and have been very fortunate in gettng lower than usual rates for the times we have stayed. The only don side is that the Au Bon Pain in the hotel usually has only one person working which makes for a long wait on occaision.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: pivko
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night in July 2009. It is a reasonable place to stay, close to the subway station, and the area did not feel unsafe even after dark. Plus the hotel provides shuttle to downtown and to the airport as well. There is a good cafe for breakfast in the lobby but the breakfast is not free. My only complaint goes to the room, which was freezing when we got there as a result of overused A/C - it was on full, even though the outside temperature was near 20 degrees. True for many U.S. hotels, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Nikisha
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in the Doubletree Club Boston Bayside. We are on a 5 week trip around the States and so far, this is the most disappointing hotel. The regular rate for a standard room is $ 209, we got it much cheaper through our travel agency but if you compare the regular rate to what you get it's just ridiculous. First of all, there is no free Wireless Internet in the rooms, you have go down to the lobby. If you want Internet in your room you have to pay $ 12.99 per 24 hours, per user. It's the first time we've encountered something like that, even in the Days Inn Motel we got free Internet in our rooms, and that was a lot cheaper. The room smells of smoke, although it's a non-smoking room. When we got into the room, a lamp was missing the lightbulb and shade. The hotel looks very run-down if look a bit closer and could use some renovating. The room service did not remove the trash and today I found a long, black hair on my pillow (none of us has black hair). The location is quite good, it takes about 10 minutes to go into downtown Boston with the subway. But other than that, the hotel is a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “really noisy”
Reviews.Author: TuckerSurrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits some miles from the centre of Boston however can be reached via the underground with the station about a 5 min walk from the hotel this isn't really a problem but mind the roads en-route to the station as they are busy. A hotel shuttle bus runs into Boston 2 times a day & picks up from the Double Tree Hotel in downtown Boston which can be helpful. A nice touch is a free drop off & pick up from Logan airport at any time by the shuttle bus but make sure to call the reception to book all shuttle bus trips!! The down side to this hotel is the noise from inside. The hallways seem to echo any noise made. The sound of doors being closed/noisy guests/people making mobile phone calls in the hall seem to be amplified making sleep nearly impossible, Clearly a big issue when you need a good nights rest

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastguy71
Reviews.Content: Had a good time here. Probably not the ideal location if you are going to a Red Sox game (2 trains there and back, the return trip packed). Not too far from the airport as well and the hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport. Free internet is available in the lobby (keep your laptop turned on in the elevator to your room and the free internet continues)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to red line, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: laruechris
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the Doubltree Bayside. It was a great deal and still close via the subway. It was clean and the staff was very helpful. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “"It looks like a hospital..."”
Reviews.Author: JAJORI
Reviews.Content: Yes, it really looks like a hospital. My teen-aged son had right. The staff of the hotel was friendly. The metro station very close, the room spacious enough and the rate acceptable. We also appreciated the airport shuttle. And the lobby is almost elegant. But the location is not very good to explore Boston. My mistake. The rooms need some renovation as soon as possible. The air-conditioning was very loud. This was my first stay at Doubletree, and not perhaps the last one, but I will be very careful when selecting it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Our 7 Nights Stay at Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: kc118tx1
Reviews.Content: The staff are very nice and professional. There is a T Station not far from the hotel. It is not "across the street" like we thought. We made sure we didn't stay out after dark. Our trip was for sight seeing and a Boston Red Sox game so we were only at the hotel to sleep. The room was very clean. We never found restaurants by the hotel so we called Dominoes several times for delivery. The price of our stay was much less than any other hotel. Once we got on the subway down from the hotel, we got were we wanted to go rather fast. The JFK Museum is very close. You can go to the T Station I mentioned and catch a bus that will take you down the street to the museum. We got there less than 10 minutes. The only "real" negative comment I am going to add is they told us we had to give them a deposit in case we rented movies, phone calls, or used the internet inside the room. This "deposit:" was several hundred dollars! I PLEADED with them that we needed that money for our trip and we would NOT do any of that stuff. They finally agreed to a $50.00 deposit which was refunded at checkout. You might check on this when you call. We found no washer/dryer facilities on the site. There was no swimming pool either which upset my kids. You can get on the internet using your laptop in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, easy access to T, breakfast a small issue”
Reviews.Author: Furball01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here doe six nights as part of a three week long tour of the North East. Rooms were quite spaciuous as were the bathrooms. The hotel provided two free internet terminals which we felt were very useful. The T (subway) stop was about a three minute walk away and stopped in Boston Common (focal point of the centre city). There was an Au Bon Pain in the hotel whcih did breakfast bagels etc but was merely satisfactory. The value for money in the hotel was quite good and I would stay here again without problem

Reviews.Title: “Yummy cookies, convenient shuttle service, close to T”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak777
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the warm cookies we received upon arriving, which we had never seen before. The shuttle service was very convenient--we used it when we arrived, when we went to pick up our rental car, after dropping off the rental car and when returning to the airport. It was conveniently located near the T station--five minute walk tops--and we didn't feel unsafe when making the walk. It was definitely not like walking down a suburban street, but you have to expect that in a city after dark. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and we had a great stay. There was also a computer center that you can use for free which was nice. There is a cafe where you can pay for breakfast which has a nice selection for reasonable prices. We recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: jdelapena
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived to Boston for the first time to attend a couple of Baseball games at Fenway Park. Since I read other reviews about the hotel being close to the subway I thought it would be very convenient, and it was. The first day we arrived we were starving and it was 8:30 and with no restaurant in the area, so we asked the front desk where to go. They offered to take us a local restaurant and pick us up, the place was ok but it didn't matter because we all hungry. During our 4 days the shuttle took us to eat 3 times wich was very nice, and also picked us up from the airport and dropped us off for our departure (the drivers are very nice). The staff was very nice and helpful, except for a young lady who works in the morning. A young Latino girl(Puertorican maybe) at the front desk was kind of rude and didn't show any customer service skills, not even fake smile, but other than her the hotel was comfortable. It is kind of small, but convenient if you want to explore Boston by using the T (subway). Oh, the chocolate chip cookies are delicious, you get one on arrival, but if you are up late and craving a dessert you can ask for one and they'll more likely be happ to give you one. Don't expect anything fancy, the room is very plain, but the beds are very comfortable. We paid a $160 on advanced payment, but wait closer to the date, the price goes down. If you pay in advance there's nothing you can do but eat the price like we did.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: eddie14418
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good deal, and want to avoid paying those high dowtown prices, consider this place. It is very reasonable, and only a very short walk to the Red Line train stop that can take you into downtown in a matter of minutes. It does not serve breakfast, but it does have a Au Bon Paine that is decent. Rooms are VERY comfortable. It's a safe place, with reasonable rates and access to the train into downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: davehammer
Reviews.Content: Got a very good deal at this conveniently located hotel for a three night break in Boston. Located a 5 min walk from the T station which will get you to downtown Boston within 10 mins. The walk itself isn't all that pleasant, there's road work everywhere and it's rather dingy at night. The hotel generally lived up to expectations. Pleasant reception staff checked us in quickly and gave us a large room overlooking the Bayside Expo centre. Not the greatest view in the world but I've had worse. Room itself was clean and tidy with a good size bathroom. The bed was large and comfortable and the air conditioning unit not too noisy. Only negatives where that the Au Bon Pain was frequently understaffed leaving long lines and up to 20 min wait just to get a bagel. This wouldn't be so much of a problem if there was somewhere else to eat in the vicinity but there isn't really. The housekeeping staff were also very noisy having loud conversations with each other in the corridors from about 8am each morning. Overall I'd recommend the place as an alternative to some of the hideous prices going around in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: MacsOnTour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 08 because of good rate. Knew it was out of town. Shuttle bus from airport was a great service. The walk to and from T into city was quite short but quite scary. Dodgy part of town with not much around. Did not feel safe on T (but that's not the hotel's fault) - felt much safer in New York. Hotel room fine, as was lobby. Breakfast at Au Pain fine. Would pay extra and stay in Boston next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the cheapest in Boston, for a reason...”
Reviews.Author: TN_Runner
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was the price. Under 200 compared with 300 - 500 for any other place in Boston for marathon weekend. The major downsides were poor service and location. You have to drive and pay huge parking fees or take a trip on the T to do anything in Boston - nothing is within walking distance of this hotel. The service was terrible - no towels on two separate days, and it took three calls to the front desk to get them sent up. Also, an unrequested wake-up call came at 3AM our first night there - no apologies from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Doubletree Boston Bayside”
Reviews.Author: rodnick
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay here for six nights in March. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff are helpful when you need assistance. Au Bon Pain is available in the lobby area and no more expensive that any other branch of that chain. Shaw's supermarket is only five minutes away if needed. Our only real problem was getting picked up by the complimentary shuttle - the guy who answered the phone thought we were at Terminal E at the Amtrak station instead of the Airport so we were asked to go to South Station to meet the shuttle - we had a laugh about that later.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path and not quite the Memory maker”
Reviews.Author: twentiethcentury
Reviews.Content: It is quite a walk to the Train and not exactly the best part of town to do that after dark. Also having booked the Memory Maker thru the Doubletree website was presented with a ticket for a limited breakfast and ONE (no more no less) beverage. Site is also very popular with the charter bus crowd. Hotel is very clean but not the Boston experience we craved.

Reviews.Title: “over night stay”
Reviews.Author: elisaross
Reviews.Content: stayed here overnight, we had a flight in the morning, we liked this hotel it was clean friendly and mostly because of the shuttle to airport was prompt and friendly. there is a cafe area. not sure if theres a restaurant. the room was small but for a overnite stay it was ok. very clean and comfortable bed and sheets.

Reviews.Title: “always a problem”
Reviews.Author: raff622
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on several trips to Boston, but would be reluctant to do so again. Arrived later in the evening and was given a room where the heat was not working. It was 17 degrees outside. The desk asked if I would like to wait 30 min to see if the heat would work or change the room. I opted for the latter.The desk was accomodating and changed the room. The second room was not as in good condition as the first, but at that hour, I let it slide.The location is out of the way and a little hard to get to...one missed turn, you're in Southie. Sometimes the parking is free, sometimes it isn't(this weekend it wasn't.). For something very basic, the place is ok. I am back in this area next month and have changed my reservation to another Hilton property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: wscooby77
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels s person can stay in when visiting Boston. Compared to other over priced hotels in Boston this hotel is excellent value for money. The hotel is part of the Hilton group of hotels, so one can imaging their service. One thing we liked about this hotel is that we only payed $10 /day for parking unlike other hotels in Boston which does not even have parking or who can charge you upto $34 / day if they have parking. So this hotel was quite reasonable. Other good part about this hotel is that, its only a short distance from downtown Boston and you can even take the "T" to the town which is only a short distance from the hotel. This can be quite handy as parking in downton is very expensive. The hotel staff is very friendly and very helpful too. The hotel room is also very clean and quite good. Also the room had all the necessities. Over all this hotel is quite good for a vacation and can be recomended to anyone

Reviews.Title: “basic but great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: stayed one night pre cruise from boston ,pick up from airport ,shuttle from hotel to city ctr ,and shuttle from hotel to cruise ship saturday morning all included in price great deal,hotel travel lodge style in/out rooms great size very clean ,staff very good ,small snack bar good choice ,metro line two minutes away ,i really liked what was on offer dont know if i would stay more than three ngts not much local activity but a great base at a fair price

Reviews.Title: “Sitting on the dock of the bay...”
Reviews.Author: Conaz
Reviews.Content: I booked this as part of my multi-city tour of the North Eastern USA, and spent my 4 Boston nights here. Doubletree, for those who don't know is part of the Hilton family of hotel brands, and as such it is very much a chain hotel. Doubletree make a thing of giving you a warm cookie when you check in, and I must admit it was a very nice cookie! One thing they don't mention, or at least wasn't mentioned by Hotels. com, is that they run a shuttle bus to a) the downtown Doubletree (which is hourly, and if you time it right saves you having to use the subway) and b) the airport. I rang the front desk from Logan when we arrived and the shuttle bus was with us within 20 minutes. The hotel itself is quite unassuming, literally next door to the Bayside Expo centre, and overlooking the bay (and by definition, about 50% of the rooms get a bay view out of the window). The rooms are standard fare for a chain hotel, with a nice comfy bed, a decent set of TV channels (plus games for an extra fee) and a desk to work at should you really feel the need. The bakery downstairs offers a good selection of pastries and the like for breakfast or snacks, and after 2pm they start selling some of the items off for $1 a piece, which is a *real* bargain. In terms of driving, if you drive to the hotel be warned it is $10 a day to use their parking lot. However, the hotel is so close to the T Station for UMass it's really well connected to downtown anyway, and there's no need to take the car in to Boston! All said and done I couldn't fault this hotel at all. Comfy, well located, and the staff are in the most helpful (if not always the sharpest minds) and will go out of their way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dewbaum
Reviews.Content: I expected this room at the Doubletree to be comparable to the very nice one I stayed in a couple of days before in Burlington, VT. It was not. It was more expensive and the room was not updated at all. No solid surface counters or nice fixtures plus the wi-fi in the room was not free, not even for Hilton HHonors members. It was very standard; typical of a Red Roof Inn or something similar. There were creepy stains on the chair and on the blanket at the foot of the bed. I expected more since I paid almost $200 for a night here. The only indication that it was a Hilton hotel was the comfortable mattress and duvet, the Nutrogena products, and the cookies you get at check in. Also, the front desk and bar staff were very friendly and they do have two computers in the lobby if you need to get online (free of charge). I would only stay here again at a greatly discounted rate because it is so, so close (about a block) to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel of our entire trip”
Reviews.Author: BJRicks
Reviews.Content: I forgot to write a few reviews of our 07 summer trip and I didn't want to forget this one. This one was by far the nicest hotel we stayed in our entire NY, New England trip. Comfort, Comfort, Comfort. Slept like babies. Mom, Dad and almost 15 year old daughter. Nice view of water. Easy Check in. Warning: Our GPS had us way off, good thing we had directions! Very easy and close access to the T transportation by a pleasant walk. Not in Boston, but then again, the T was so fast it didn't matter. Very pleasant. The only Negative was the cost of the deli breakfast which wasn't very good. Maybe that has changed.... No options around, either. We ate in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service at Doubletree Boston Bayside”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubltree Boston Bayside in Novemeber of '07. My choice was motivated by the fact that it was the most reasonably priced hotel for the timframe I was traveling and as I am a Hilton Honors member decided to give it a try. I Took the Amtrak Acela, a relaxing 3-1/2 hour trip frop from NYC. Arrived at South Station at 1:30 P.M.and connected with the "T" (subway) for a two stop ride south to the JFKUMass stop.I walked into the hotel around 2:00 - made great time. I greatly enjoyed my stay at this property. I found the service outstanding from check-in to check-out; the chocolate-chip cookies upon check-in are sooooo addictive and delicious! I bought two tins to take home with me. The only wrinkle in my stay was that I was given a double-bedded room instead of the king I had rrequested; even with that though, I found the room quite spacious and comfortable, so it was not a major problem in my opinion as I was traveling solo. I can understand other writers' concern with the neighborhood. I do agree that there is not much in the immediate area. However, I disagree that it is a bad or dangerous area. The subway is only two bloxks away and is used at all times and contributes to much foot traffic through the late night hours - I regularly returned from town late at night and had no problems - the area also has a visible secu- rity presence due to the University of Massachessetts and the Bay- side Convention Center both across from the hotel (just two blocks from the "T". Also, the JFK Library and Museum is about a mile away from the hotel. This is a must-see experience. If you cannot walk take a cab! And speaking of transportation, a word about the hotel shuttle - it only runs until 9:00 P.M. and only goes to the downtown Boston Doubletree in the Theatre District, so if you want the shuttle for the return trip you need to find your own way to that hotel. In my opinion the advantage of a shuttle is to pick you up anywhere within a certain radius as in other properties I have stayed. This setup can- cels out that convienience. I was fine taking the "T" duiring my entire stay so I was not affected by this - I only mention this for other guests to be aware of. Regarding the hotel itself, I had a great stay as mentioned above. My room was spacious and spotlessly clean with all the ame- nities I needed.The entire property is in pristine condition and very welcoming and homey, especially in the morning where guests carried their breakfast into the beautiful sun-filled lobby and also at night when guests would congregate at the bar. The restaurant at the hotel is an Au Bon Pain outlet which may not suit all tastes, and while it may have its limitations, the food was good and filling. The breakfasts were just fine and reasonably priced with several hot specials offered each morning. The rest of the menu is mostly sandwiches, salads, pastries (including those chocolate-chip cookies) and coffee. So if you had a more substantial meal in mind (esp. for dinner) you would either have to go out or order from the room service directory which features delivery from several local restaurants. That said, Boston has many excellent restaurants all over town and you will most likely not even miss not having dinner in the hotel. The entire staff was very helpful and accomodating with any request I had - housekeeping,restaurant recommendations or reservations, sightseeing or anything else I approached them about. The staff of a hotel can often make or break one's stay, but there was no problem here - everyone was great. In summary, the Doubletree Boston Bayside is an overlooked bargain (by Boston standards) and should be considered at any time, including when downtown properties are either booked full or too expensive. The "T" is only a short walk from the hotel and will take you anywhere in minutes and more than makes up for the hotel's somewhat unusual location. It is a welcome alternative to the way overpriiced digs in downtown and elsewhere and should be seriously considered when visiting the Boston area. I am sure the Doubletree will not disappoint, so give it a try. I would certainly consider this hotel if my travels take me to Boston in the future, The price is right, the staff is terrific, and the rooms are comfortable. What more could one ask? .

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXCELLENT HOTEL... AND GREAT VALUE TO BOOT !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gracebaymay506
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a weekend in Boston on 23-Sep-08 and I booked a night at the Doubltree Club Hotel - Boston Bayside. AWESOME stay! Extremely clean room, VERY comfortable bed with a warm cookie waiting on our pillow. Had Neutrogena products in the spotless bathroom, great coffee in the room, (a chef's blend none the less)...plenty of towels, never ran low on anything as room service was EXCELLENT, and had a great view of the City of Boston. (recommend an end unit)...plenty of windows. We were not familiar with the T; and the extremely helpful people at the front desk gave us the info. we needed; including restaurants, etc.. Furthermore, we were able to take advantage of their free shuttle service when we were tired and just wanted to avoid the T... late at night; so because it was late and the driver was NOT on his regularly scheduled stops, we called the hotel just for the heck of it, and asked if they could come and pick us up. He came within 10-15 minutes with a huge smile and brought us back to the hotel. They have a wonderful Au Bon Pain inside the lobby; where they make INCREDIBLE wraps or bagel sandwiches... very healthy options and terrific coffees. The girl working that morning was sweet as can be. They also offer free interenet service in the lobby as well. EXCELLENT SERVICE at this hotel all around; very helpful, friendly people working here and for the price, you CANNOT beat it, as far as I'm concerned. Try finding a hotel soooo close to everything under $200/nite; it's basically impossibe unless it's a dump. It's extremely easy to get to also; because it's just off of Rte. 93; so you don't drive directly into the City persay, it's a wonderful location! Don't quite understand, honestly about a previous poster claiming it's not in the best part of town? It's totally fine. The parking is only $10.00/day and it's a gated lot; so I didn't worry about my car at all the whole weekend. I would DEFINETELY recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a really nice place to stay just outside the madness that won't charge ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, not great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MelissaAmy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice enough for a Doubletree. We had a one bedroom suite with our infant and it was quite nice. The hotel provided us a crib but had no highchairs as other hotels often do. We had a nice room on the 6th floor overlooking the bay. While the kitchen does have a microwave and a mini fridge, it has NO other provisions (plates, paper towels, silverware). Other Doubletree hotels we've stayed at have been much better stocked. In addition, the neighborhood is a bit rough around the edges. With a baby, we weren't taking public transportation and had to drive into Boston daily. This is not that bad of a drive, but not too convenient overall. If you want to stay at a downtown Boston hotel, this location is not for you. Other than the T, there is no where to walk from this hotel (and even if there was, I wouldn't walk late at night or by myself).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: BucksfaninMO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a kid-free getaway for a few days and the minute we stepped in to the lobby I was glad that I selected this hotel. Jennifer greated us with a smile and warm cookie. Check in is 3pm but we arrived around noon due to an early flight. She got us right to a room and even gave us a harbor view. Free shuttle to the downtown Doubletree (about a 10 min ride). The subway is also only one block away. Au Bon Pain is a nice little deli/bakery off of the lobby. Dont pay for the breakfast rate, just get it on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Some staff unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Sally J M
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find that we had been allocated a smoking room and tried to get it changed. The girl on the desk tried to blame us and say that we had specifically asked for a smoking room. We manged to reach a compromise but then found neither of our rooms were ready! If you phone the hotel from the airport they will fetch you in the shuttle bus. The bus does run hourly into town but to the sister hotel located in China Town. The hotel is well situated for the 'T', buy a 'Charlie Card' which is a travel card and you will not need a car. The rooms are clean and perfectly adequate. Breakfast is not included and not worth the cost. Boston is a fantastic city-do experience a 'Duck Tour'-its worth the cost but do book or you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Recommandable Hotel To Boston”
Reviews.Author: tp1957
Reviews.Content: Location: very convinient to public transportation. The rooms were clean and tidy. Even the smorking rooms were similar to those that were non-smoking. I think by what the say that it's a smoking room is that people can smok in there. I didn't find much difference expect maybe the first time you open the closet door. Service: excellent Generally, it is nearly excellent. I would stay there again. Although no free wi-fi, no breakfast and no free parking. IT's VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: chris2423
Reviews.Content: The rate was very reasonable for high season in Boston. The hotel was nicer than I expected it to be. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The hotel in general was very clean. Great place for families. We didn't move our car the whole time we were there. Took the T everywhere. The T stop was a 2 minute walk and was alway pretty populated so we never felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: jmarie426
Reviews.Content: I only paid $129/night to stay at this hotel and it was well worth it! The room and bathroom was clean and comfortable, and the bed was so comfortable! Although there is no restaurant hotel nor room service, there is an Au Bon Pain located in the hotel as well as a bar. The Staff was always helpful and friendly, and we were greeted with warm chocolate chip cookies (with nuts!). There is a $10 parking charge, but that's not so unreasonable in Boston. It was okay though, as they let us keep the car there for the day after check out. The T is only a short walk away, so it's very convenient. My only complaint is that the hotel leads you to believe the exercise facility is in the hotel, when in reality you have to take the train over to UMass to use it. But it was really a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Complain”
Reviews.Author: Laurelita42
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Club is easy enough to use as a base when you're in Boston- it's on the Red Line T, from the station its only a 2 or 3 minute walk to the hotel. We had a great rate for our stay and really couldn't find anything to complain about. As we waited to check in we were asked by a staff member if we needed any help with restaurant choices, and when we later approached him he seemed very vague and couldn't really give us anything to go on, which we thought was a bit odd since he had come up to us first, but it was no big deal in the long run. Our room was exactly that- it was clean, big enough for three of us, and nothing was broken. I'd suggest that if you were looking for something upscale to head closer into the city but for the price (I've stayed at some pricey places ($400+ /night) right in the middle of the city) it really couldn't be beat for us. As others have mentioned, there is an Au Bon Pain off the lobby which is a nice option in the morning. All in all, if we returned to Boston and were just looking for a clean and comfortable place to sleep at night, we would certainly not hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: pugmama007
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, that were clean and spacious. In room coffee maker & hairdryer and very big, soft towels. They had a friendly and helpfull staff. The hotel is a bit outside of downtown Boston but is a very short walk to the transit station and it's very simple to catch a train that takes you downtown in about 15 mins. We were there to go to two Red Sox games an it was an easy commute to get there by transit. We didn't have time to explore the beach next to the hotel while we were there, but you could see that it was a short walk to the shoreline from the hotel. The hotel does have a restarant open during 'normal' meal times' and for after hours snacks they have takeout menus available at the front desk where you can call a few places nearby (Italian, Chinese & Japanese) for delivery direct to your room up until 1am. We ordered some hot sub sandwiches one night at midnight - quite tasty! The Doubletree Club was an extremely pleasant surprise. I would definitely go back on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Jessica at the Front Desk Was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: stevienixfanmike
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I had been planning this trip for a few months as we had tickets to see Stevie Nicks in concert at the Bank of America Pavillion. We had printed MapQuest directions but still could not find the hotel. We called the Double Tree and Jessica gave great directions. It only took us 10 minutes to find the hotel. She was also very plesant at check-in. Another young woman working the front desk was not quite as pleasant. Unfortunately, she came across as being "bothered" to have to wait on customers and was busy talking with a "friend" who stood in front of customers at the front desk. Jessica was very professional and told us about everything the hotel offerred and gave us room keys very promptly. The lobby is huge but the bar they have is very small. It is tucked away in a tiny corner and the bartender made very weak drinks. It was still a nice touch after a long day. Au Bon Pain is located in the lobby and has nice foods, but it is not open late in the evening. The hotel also has an ATM machine and business center which is nice. The hotel is very close to the red line T. It only takes about 10 minutes to get to Downtown Crossing. Jessica also was nice enough to call us a taxi to the Bank of America Pavillion. The price was close to $10. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A nice STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: dogboy69
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints about this hotel. They have a free shuttle to the other Doubletree which is in Chinatown and to the airport. Boston is easy to get around with the METRO so no need to rent a car. Room was comfy & clean. Au bon Pain is in the lobby. It is ok for a snack. I would avoid the Pizza it was undecooked and you would be better off with pizza delivery to the hotel. Not many restaurants nearby, but the Metro is only $2.00. Highly Recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected from a DoubleTree Hotel”
Reviews.Author: npv_design
Reviews.Content: My company placed me in this hotel since most other hotels were booked graduation weekend... so I was thankful i got a room. HOWEVER, there were several issues with this hotel. First- the condition of the interior of the rooms was bad. Furniture was busted, the chair next to my bed had all sorts of stains on it (so gross), the lamp was not working, A/C was not working properly- as i found out in the middle of the night- and on top of that- the room smelled like smoke. Some other people from the conference who were also staying at this hotel complained of their allergies flaring up, so be prepared. The people at the front desk were helpful-so there wasn't any issue with customer service. There was no concierge as some other people have already said... so know where you want to go- and DEFINITELY- bring your own pillowcase and bedsheet.

Reviews.Title: “Poor services, decent value”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithmike
Reviews.Content: Some observations from an unremarkable stay: Positives: 1. Close to bay sidewalk - fantastic for running on. 2. Close to the JFK train station, but I'm not sure I'd walk through the neighborhood at night. 3. Au Bon Pain â€“ Open late, consistent food and nice folks behind the counter (one poor fellow couldn't speak English, but was otherwise helpful) Negatives: 1. No service elevators. The elevator would sometime open to the employee lounge. There were constantly linen bins in the hallways and elevators. 2. Understaffed front desk. Five minute wait for any questions 3. Rude front desk â€“ â€œWhat time would you like you wake callâ€� Me â€œ6 am pleaseâ€� them â€œclickâ€� .

Reviews.Title: “No car needed”
Reviews.Author: mudballer
Reviews.Content: My husband, 9 year old daughter and I stayed here in July 07. It was our first trip to Boston and we loved it. There was no need for a car the entire trip. The hotel picked us up from the airport and took us back. It also had a shuttle that took you straight into downtown Boston which was only a couple of miles away. If that was not enough, there was a T train station about 1/4 mile walk from the hotel. The T was surprisingly simple for us first timers and felt perfectly safe. It is not in the heart of downtown Boston just a few miles out so the price for the hotel was much more reasonable. Our room was large and very clean with lots of big fluffy pillows. The lobby had a bar, a small cafe and a business center where you could use the internet. The cafe was good for breakfast and a small lunch but not for dinner. Not a big enough selection. All in all if your looking for a nice clean place with free transportation to and from the airport and downtown Boston for a good price, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Where to begin ...”
Reviews.Author: Trish0928
Reviews.Content: I pretty much always stay at Hilton properties since I'm in their HHonors program--the only problem can be that they can be hugely expensive in downtown areas. I had originally booked a room at another hotel in the suburbs, but I was browsing around and saw the Doubletree Club. Wow, only a few miles from Logan, near the T ... and it was cheap! Since I was going to be in Boston most of the time anyway I jumped on it. The first impressions were good--the shuttle was prompt, I was warmly welcomed, got my cookie, and the room was clean. Then the problems began. First, getting charged for internet access. Hilton does offer free internet at some of their names (Hampton Inn, regular Hilton and Garden Inn), but at Doubletrees it's $10/day. Not only that, but only wireless is available AND you can't print from your room despite instructions to the contrary. The hotel is conveniently located about a block from the T but I'd think twice before going there or coming back at night; this place isn't in the best neighborhood. Your only food options on site is an Au Bon Pain, properly overpriced. Housekeeping? Thanks to the room next door having a "do not disturb" sign that the housekeeper interpreted as covering my room also my room was not cleaned ONCE during my three-day stay, even after I'd gone to the front desk and advised them the first time it happened and the front desk person actually came back with me to see that there was no sign on my door. I'm not one of those people who nitpicks and I've had enough experiences with Hilton to realize this is the exception rather than the norm, but this place is bad news. I wouldn't stay here again for free.

Reviews.Title: “Base for Boston sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Engineer_Bob
Reviews.Content: Our extended family group (4 adults, 2 college students, and 2 high school students) stayed here for two nights in late March, occupying three rooms and using the hotel as our base for sightseeing in the Boston metro area. The hotel itself is moderately priced and much as we'd expected: reasonably comfortable and clean, but showing its age and offering few amenities. "Bayside" is a bit of a stretch, although the bay is a short walk away and visible from the upper floors. The hotel is adjacent to a large convention center; fortunately there was nothing booked there during our stay and I suspect the hotel is fully occupied during conventions. The JFK Library/UMass transit station is just a couple of blocks away, making it quite easy to get into town and all of the city sights. The hotel also offers a free shuttle bus to Logan Airport every hour (but you must make reservations to ensure a seat). A small coffee/pastry/sandwich shop and an even smaller bar are located in the lobby; there are no other on-site restaurants. However, there's a large grocery within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with lack of food options”
Reviews.Author: blueberry_nyc
Reviews.Content: I stay quite frequently at Hilton properties but this was the very first time that I stayed at a Doubletree. While the hotel was OK, it suffered tremendously from the lack of food options. Room service is not available and guests are limited to the Au Bon Pain in the lobby of the hotel. I was traveling to Boston on business, so this was a big disappointment for me. Other negatives: - slow check-in - loud a/c - location - far from downtown and the pluses: - comfortable bed I would probably not stay here again - i hope this is not a good representation of other Doubletree's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: sleepy_04
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful and friendly front desk staff. The complementary shuttle from the hotel to the downtown area was great... very handy since driving in Boston isn't recommended to those that are new to the area. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Primitive meal arrangements”
Reviews.Author: chalmac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convenient situation for one of the Boston convention centres, and is linked to the city centre by subway. Our room was acceptable in size, and comfortable. The outstanding fault was the fact that the hotel has no dining room, merely a breakfast bar from which one chooses from a list of sandwiches and other breakfast food, and then carries into the lobby (or one's bedroom) to eat. The system leads to queues, and is generally primitive.s

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: EmmaSt_Albans_Herts
Reviews.Content: Further away from town than we would have liked and the shuttle service got over-booked. Some of the staff seemed a little indifferent. But others were really excellent. We had reserved a rollaway bed but it was not in the room. They then took it to the smaller of the two rooms we occupied making the already tiny space even more reduced. When the bed was moved to make way for the rollaway, the dust underneath was 3 inches thick. They also did not clear away the dirty coffee cup from one day to the next. The in-house Au Bon Pain was welcome both for breakfast and snack times and the staff there were extremely helpful. The surrounding area VERY ugly with the Expo next door with views of either the main road or a huge car park.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JacobBenjamin
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the Doubletree Club Hotel Bayside very much. A clean room, comfortable beds, friendly staff and a free shuttle bus downtown. Highly recommendable for a short stay in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Convienience all around - Great for business”
Reviews.Author: msaguirre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was the cheapest hotel in the Boston area with a "reputable" name. We ended up staying on the parking lot side of the hotel which had the worst view of them all, but I've heard the opposite side has a great view of the city and bay. Unfortunately, there was no pool, which is a typical must for us... however the Au Ban Pain downstairs near the bar and lobby was great for breakfast and lunch, especially on the run. We could pick up a gourmet sandwich before catching the train into the city. The station is only a couple blocks away, not to mention the close proximity of the Bayside Expo Center. Service was great, and our stay was extremely comfortable. We chose a non-smoking room, although there was still a slight hint of smoke from previous guests. It was quiet at night, mostly because our window was on the expo center parking lot side. This hotel is centered more for business trips or the casual yet economical traveler. There isn't anything adventurous about booking at a standard commercial hotel such as this one. Double Tree is however a very classy hotel compared to other hotels in their niche. This one in particular is very clean and well furnished complimented by its luxurious style. I did not stay for a business trip, but would definitely consider this hotel for a executive corporate meeting for my company. If you want a normal, quiet and comfortable night - all for the right cost in Boston, I suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful beds, but bring EARPLUGS!”
Reviews.Author: TeaEarleGreyHot
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via an opaque prepaid service where I named my own price. Although I got a discount, they made up for it with the $10 parking fee and $10 internet charge. And the internet service was terrible, cutting in and out made some of my online sessions impossible. The room was pleasantly decorated, though small and fairly basic. The two double beds were very comfortable, with feather pillows, duvet, fine sheets, etc. Bedding was clean. Soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion were provided. Towels were clean and fine. The water pressure was strong, and water temperature control was easy. Unfortunately, the carpeting was stained, and looked dirty in spots. And there were many strands of long, dark hair from a previous guest on the floor, tub, toilet, and counter. And the shower diverter valve was broken, so control of the water was difficult. The worst part of the stay was the paper-thin walls, and having my sleep interrupted when the guests nextdoor got in at 2am, and their general conversation was audible (and quite clearly heard) for the next hour. Plumbing and bathroom activities were also heard. This hotel really should provide earplugs!!! In the meanwhile, bring your own, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Very cold all night”
Reviews.Author: beautiful275
Reviews.Content: We printed the directions off of their website. We got severly lost and ended up on the other side of town. When we called for directions, the front desk agent gave us directions that had us heading into downtown Boston. You would think that if someone works there, that they would know how to get there? When we turned around and started heading back to where we had come from, we saw one of their vans SPEEDING through town. We followed him back. We got there an hour after we should have there. When we walked in, we were informed that there was a parking fee, when on the website, it had said nothing about it. When informing the clerk of this she did not apologize, just handed us a ticket to put in our car window. When we got up to our room, it was next to the stairs, firstly. That bothered me. It is known in the hospilatly industry that you save those rooms for sold out nights, and they were not sold out, far from it. Our entrance light did not work and our room was frigid. It wouldn't hurt if they turned on the heat before someone checks in. We turned the heat up to high and it took the full eight hours from 10pm until 6am when we got up, make the room warm. Luckily, when we go to a hotel, we always bring an extra blanket, because there is never enough blankets. and they are always so thin! Also, we were there for first night in Boston. The parking lot was extremely icy. I had sneakers on, but most of the other guests were going out the clubs and the girls had heels on. There was no salt on the parking lot anywhere. Someone could have slipped, I was afraid I was going to. I hate ice! The breakfast the next morning was cold, the eggs were cold, the coffee was burnt and I asked for sauages and I received bacon. I left a letter at the front desk with this information when we left and a comment card in the room and I have not received a phone call or an email. I worked in hotel for three years. I know how it runs. If my GM had received all these compliants from one person, he would have been on the phone personally apologizing. I am not impressed. We almost turned around and went home, just because the directions were so horrible. But we wanted to see the fireworks, so we went and we stayed and we ffroze. It was warmer outside, than it was in our room. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on priceline here (around $55)...the staff is wonderful, they do charge for parking but its not too bad- like $10 a day or so when i was there....its close to a T stop and takes like 20 minutes to most places in Boston. All in all this is a very solid choice for cheaper accomodations in the Boston area (more accessible than Cambridge).

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Bayside”
Reviews.Author: pugzmama
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree near the Bayside Expo Center while attending an event at Bayside. The property is very conveinent to Bayside (right across the parking lot), but otherwise doesn't offer much. The rooms were outfitted nicely in terms of linens, furniture and tolitries, but the heater/ac is a huge pain. They have window AC/heaters and they are very hard to regulate - I got up in the middle of the night every night to switch the heat on and off. This hotel is not conveinent to downtown at all, although they do offer a shuttle service. There is no room service, only a small Au Bon Pain downstairs - fare is mediocre and inconsistent. The workout room is ok if you are only there a day or 2. The hotel offers access to the Mass U facilities, but I was told they didn't open until 11am - kind of late if you are in town for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: intl_realist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great bargain for under $100 per night, considering the cost of everything in downtown Boston. The hotel is a short walk (around 5 minutes) to the JFK/UMASS red line subway station. Once on the subway your only 10 minutes from the center of Boston. There were only two issues I had with the hotel: 1. The walls are paper thin. We could hear our neighbor's television and bed squeaking (who only knows what was going on). 2. The airconditioning unit was more like a fan than an airconditioner. Other than that everything was fine. Next time in Boston we will definitely by staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied...........”
Reviews.Author: J0hnlav
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, One for us and one for my 92 year old Father. The shuttle was very useful, taking us into the other Double Trees in town, by the hospital. Rooms were first class but the breakfast ( not included) was a bit of a struggle for Father. (English beware.) The shuttle was not always on time which was a problem. I would recommend this hotel, apart from the above.

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Dublin
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location just of the highway. Quite and clean rooms. Friendly staff. Very close to Boston and the T. Convenient coffee shop in lobby for early risers.

Reviews.Title: “Great suprise”
Reviews.Author: Niels2
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is part of the Hilton family group and I was suprised at the service available at the hotel. The hotel is located appr. a 10 minute taxi ride (unless you're in one at rush hour!!!) from downtown Boston. The general service was excellent and very friendly. I felt well attended to and was made to feel that the staff was genuinely interested in me having a good stay. My room was spacious, very clean, and the bed was huge (though I did sleep in it alone, it could easily fit two people). There are pay per view movies (I had a glitch with one of the movies, called the front desk and two minutes later a technician knocked on my door to look at the problem. The problem was not resolved but when I called the front desk to make sure I wasn't invoiced for the movie, it was already taken care of...). The bathroom is spacious and spotless. The coffee machine took about 1 hour to make a !/4th cup of coffee but I could live with that since the reception facilites had a bakery. The two free internet computers by the lobby were a grea addition and i didn't have to wait for availability (though I might have been lucky). In general , the room was quiet and comfortable. Also, there is a supermarket 5 minutes from the hotel and the subway is right next to it. Safe area. Very little dining opportunities. Taxis are easy to get through the hotel,. The hotel shuttle is also a nice touch, espeically when getting to the airport (make sure to reserve a seat in good time). I would resommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Gotthetravelbug81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree from Sept. 10th-11th. I have to admit everyone was absolutely right about the delicious chocolate chip cookies. They were very tasty and a wonderful welcoming treat! The reason we selected this hotel was the price ($118, plus parking-$9/day) and the location. We wanted to be near downtown Boston, but didn't want to pay the hefty price. The Doubletree was perfect because it is two blocks from the T (red/green line). We walked over in the morning, bought a day pass, and spent the rest of our day in the heart of Boston. We really didn't spend any other time at the hotel or in our room except to sleep. Overall, the hotel was nice and I can't complain about the warm cookies! P.S. If you want two GREAT restaurants in Boston, try Vida Dolce (Italian) and Stephanie's on Newbury (try the meatloaf)! Both are EXCELLENT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, inexpensive South Boston area hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZCat
Reviews.Content: First directions: hotel is adjacent to Bayside Expo Center. Use directions on hotel website but when you enter the rotary look for the Expo Center exit off the rotary. We chose this hotel because it was near a T stop, much cheaper than downtown and a good base for travels south to Cape Cod and Nantucket. Parking is $9 per day. Rooms were clean with plenty of thick fluffy towels. Toiletries replaced daily. Unlike some inexpensive hotels, cable TV had many channels. USA Today delivered every morning. Lobby is very nice with tables and seating areas, two TVS and a bar. Free wi-fi in Lobby. Also hotel provides a room with 3 free internet-access computers, each with a printer. Great for getting last minute info before heading out for the day. There is an Au Bon Pain bakery in the Lobby open from 6am to 11pm. They sell fruit, pastries, soups, sandwiches and Chicago Uno Pizza. For joggers, Dorchester Bay and Columbus Park are directly across the parking lot in back of the hotel. JFK-UMASS stop on the redline is a 5 minute walk. There's a Shaw's/Osco near the T-stop. Hotel shuttle stops at Doubletree Downtown but subway is faster. We took subway and felt very safe in the area. Also Columbus Park area was safe for jogging. Downside: nothing in immediate area for an evening meal and if you drive to restaurants on Dorchester Ave., there's not much parking. Several restaurants do deliver to hotel. Great location for UMASS visitors and close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Libralady
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights over Labor Day weekend at the Doubletree Club Hotel in Boston and would definitely return. The lobby is spacious, with many chairs and couches for relaxing, plus tables and chairs to use after purchasing a meal at the Au Bon Pain cafe just off the lobby. The personnel was very friendly and helpful, and the housekeeping staff kept the room spotless. Our room was quite large, with the very comfortable "Sweet Dreams" bedding - great nights' sleep. We also had a lovely view of the bay from the 5th floor. The train/bus station is only about a block away which made travel into the city easy. The hotel also offers complimentary shuttle service to the airport and to the downtown Doubletree location.

Reviews.Title: “Super handicapped friendly”
Reviews.Author: timikt
Reviews.Content: Great experience. We had a handicapped-accessible room and it was great. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. The bed was good, and had a feather-bed top sheet gave a really nice sleep feel. The shower was strong and fitted with two heads- one lower and hand-held if a wheelchair were needed, and the toilet was raised. Grab-bars were everywhere in the bath. Staff was very helpful, cookie was warm and yummy, and the daily "USA Today" was appreciated. We were traveling with friends, and the tables downstairs (which were plentiful) were perfect for card games at the end of our busy tourist days. Access to the "T" is easy, and the hotel provides a free shuttle to downtown or the airport. Drawbacks ( which resulted in the "above average" rather than "excellent" rating): minimal food service, no shuttle to South Station, and the inability to conveniently buy a paper on the weekend. Howver, these complaints were minor, and we will stay there again on our next trip. We even had a mini-view of the ocean- okay, it was just a peek, but it was there!

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree Club by Hilton Hotel Boston Bayside
HotelInfo.Address: 240 Mount Vernon Street at Bayside Center, Boston, MA 02125
